text: The ambience is great here. Make sure you sit outside overlooking the hills of North Scottsdale. The food is average, but not bad.
Great nachos! They are huge and the best I have ever had.  Fish tacos also awesome. Service was great.

I came here last weekend and LOVED it! The environment here is great for a date night. Our server, Melissa, was so friendly and knowledgeable about the menu! She recommended their house tequila and it was bomb!

We found glass on the lemons that were brought for our water. That's bad enough, but when I pointed it out to the manager he just told me that they threw the lemon slices away. No compensation...no offer for dessert. Nothing else! Glass??? The food was so-so and overpriced, no rice or beans with the fajitas, chips and salsa are extra... Who's ever heard of that with Mexican restaurant? I think they just take advantage of people that come to the Boulders or are in the area vacationing. I would look elsewhere for Mexican restaurant!  (I thought the waitress was nice, however.)

We just moved here and had a family-from out of town- dinner here.  We are searching and trying to find some favorite restaurants.  Spotted Donkey is a great space, open and well decorated.  They sat us at an uncomfortable table for 5, but I think there are no good tables for 5.    The waiter started to ask about drinks and responded to an innocent question about types of tequila with a 7 minute monologue about the special tequilas they buy and how awesome the margaritas are.  It was 7 minutes more about tequila than I really wanted to know.  Especially since the margaritas ended up being inconsistent from one drink to the next.  Other than the tequila rant, the service was outstanding.   We started with an order of guacamole.  And they really did charge $11 for a small scoop of guacamole and  $7 for chips and salsa.  At that point I'm not sure I cared that they were good.  I ordered the squash quesadillas.  The veggies were crisp and it was tasty.  I enjoyed them.  But other folks didn't care for the mole, or the enchiladas.

I wouldn't by any means necessarily call this authentic Mexican food, it is very American style driven, but in saying that the food was delicious and prepared well. I will be returning, but not because I feel like having real Mexican food. (I have had a lot of authentic Mexican food)

On September 6, 2014, a friend and I faced one of the worst meals of our lives.  The seafood enchiladas were soggy mushed fish in soggier tortillas, and they were repulsive.  Imagine putting canned tuna through a blender, and that's what our food looked like.  I counted only 2 whole shrimp, and I never saw a sign of crabmeat.  Don't waste your money and your time at SDC.  Far better food is available at a Rubio's that serves tasty fish tacos and other fish treats.  You'll pay far less at Rubio's, and you'll enjoy well-prepared food.

Spotted by two weekends ago to get lunch while in the area.   Was pleasantly surprised with the Nachos, not the typical Nachos, almost like a Chilaquile.  They were great!   The shimp appetizer looked fantastic.   The drinks were good!    Will reserve the 5 star for when we can make it to dinner there since we live in Ahwatukee.  Definitely stop by.
Food quality is not what it use to be, we had nachos and the stew. Been going here every Jan for 5 years, don't know if we will be back.

Delicious! I love nachos and this was the first time I've had the pulled pork variety and it was plentiful and delicious. After salting the guac, it was great--fresh, rich, creamy and very flavorful. I had the carne asade, which was very well-seasoned and my fiance had the enchiladas. We left full and satisfied, having eaten way too many nachos and guacamole. If I'm ever in that forsaken part of AZ, I'd be down for making a pit stop at this spot.

Came here with a big work group. The Spotted Donkey offers solid Tex-Mex that seems more Tex than Mex in a great casual setting. Can't beat the location if you're staying at the Boulders.   Portions here are humungous and I could barely make a dent in my entree after some appetizer rounds.   I tried: - ceviche: well done, perfect mix of saltiness and not too much 'filler' veggies - jalapeño poppers - breaking was a little burnt. I liked the presentation in a shot glass and the fact that fresh jalapeño was used - tacos - I got the chicken tacos because it was one of the few items not fried and/or smothered in cheese. This was a solid choice, but I didn't like that it was dark meat vs chicken breast  Drinks and service were a highlight. Special props for making me a Paloma (like a margarita but better) without my having to explain the ingredients.

Friends recommended this restaurant and now we do to. The waitstaff was friendly and efficient and the food was excellent. The atmosphere was a little sterile, but we came for the food.   I had a honey glazed salmon fillet on a tostada that was excellent and my wife really enjoyed her pork tenderloin on a bed of Mac and cheese.   The only con were the drinks. My iced tea was no better than the Lipton sun tea I make at home in a mason jar. My wife had a margarita which she thought was delicious, but when I got the bill her 8 oz drink cost $16. My salmon was only $17.   Overall though, a very good meal.
Good food, good service, and the nachos are really good.  Outside patio is great in the summer.

Had a fantastic time.  Get the salsa trio and chips - positively delicious!  Definitely try the double barrel spotted donkey tequila - ultra smooth and flavorful - just wish we could have bought a bottle!

The most amazing calamari I have ever had in my life! You've never had calamari like this! They use a different part of octopus then everywhere else. Its so moist! Omg! Also got the huevo rolls, very good too!  The naranja margarita was the most delicious drink I've ever had, be careful, I could easily have one too many of these! You can barely taste the tequila, but even with my high tolerance, felt it after one. Every one here was super friendly and the manager, or guy that sat us was pretty charming and cute! Don't sleep on this place!

Fun atmosphere, but on the expensive side for mexican food. No free chips and salsa??...not used to that coming from Texas. Tacos were great, perfect portion size, chicken was better than the beef, which was a little tough. Overall, good and I would go back.

I was so disappointed!  Went during restaurant week and assumed this is when you put your best foot forward to attract new guests...Not!  Service was lack luster- and the food- I don't know where to begin...perhaps at the end with the ice cream that tasted like the freezer.  My pork had so much sauce on it I couldn't taste the meat and 2 of the 3 salsas served with our chips was so watery - one of them (it was green and watery) was sweet???
Love this place! Everything is great here!!  Jalapeno shooters are great! enchalitas also a fav!  Miss the Ben and Jerry's downstairs!

My husband and I came up from Tucson for a quick getaway and were pleasantly surprised by the yummy food at this cozy restaurant. We shared a veggie quesadilla appetizer that was big enough for a meal, and the pintos tacos- 2 beef and 2 pork. The beef barbacoa was moist and flavorful. Next time I would get all beef. I even liked the rice, and usually only like Villa in Tucson's. The beans were very good too. The only reason for the 4 star, instead of 5 is that you pay for chips and salsa if you want them. I am just used to them coming with the meal in Tucson. Our server was super attentive and honest about the choices, which we appreciated!

I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone. My husband's family was visiting from out of state and we decided on The Spotted Donkey for dinner. We approached the hostess stand and asked for a table for four. The hostess asked if we had reservations and my husband said no, and then asked if we needed them to be seated. She laughed in his face and replied, "Well it would certainly help!" We turned around and walked out, deciding to eat at Cartwright's instead.

I have finally found a mexican/southwestern restaurant that lives up to the fact that it"s IN the southwest! Seriously, iI've had better mexican food in Chicago than most places in Scottsdale/Phoenix! I am happy to report that this place really satisfied an intense mexican craving.  The guacomole is an absolute must order. It seems a little pricey, but it is a very large order (4 hungry girls and 2 baskets of chips didn't finish it) and the chips are bottomless.  Skip the queso, it was too thin and not spicy enough for my taste. I would definitely recommend the chimichangas   Beautiful presentation, crispy, just the right amount of spice, and tender chicken.  While the mexican beer braised enchiladas were good, they didn't live up to their name. I couldn't taste any beer flavor, and the meat could have been a little more tender. My friends reported the shrimp and chicken tacos were both good, but their favorite part was the beans served on the side. Its like a mexican style baked bean...fantastic! It was a quiet night at the restaraunt, which was the lone drawback as I like a place full of people. Although it was nice to be seated immediately and be able to hear your friends without shouting! I will definitely make it a point to return when the weather is nicer to take advantage of their patio, it looked very inviting. All in all, I would definitely give a high recommendation to try this place out. It's worth the drive!
very good service. the bar is fun to hang out at. one of the bartenders is a wildfire fighter. he has some very wild stories to tell a great place. P.S. great food too. yum.

I am a fan of mexican food and this place has some good chow downs.  I like when restaurants give you so much food that you can go home and enjoy the food later.  This place offers that.  The service was great and the cheese caso with tortilla chips was amazing.  The food was pretty good as well. I had chicken enchiladas and an awesome margarita that was purple.   Good for groups of 2-6  It's a great place for people you have out of town guests in and live in the area or a fun spot for a nice evening out on a date.  I came from tempe so the drive was a shlep but I was not disappointed by the food and the company.    Recommendation: To anyone who enjoys mexican food as much as I do,  make sure you pack an extra stomach when going, and don't plan on doing anything after-words except lying on the couch

I was truly disappointed with the food between is having two  entrées, both had no real flavor other than weird with horrible after-taster. Needless to say we will not back. And to charge for chips and salsa which is normally fee at most Mexican restaurants

This place is fantastic. Food was delicious and customer service was even better. They assisted me in planning a get together for 30 people on less than 2 days notice.  Everything was set up beautifully and the food was hot and ready for us when we arrived. Everyone complimented the venue as well as the food and drinks. Thank you so much!
Best guacamole I've ever had. Ever.  Pumpkin seed salad was amazing and deserves a 5.  House salad was also very good, but compared to the pumpkin seed one, it should get only 4 stars.
Fun place to get nice Mexican and Southwestern style food.  The excellent margaritas are a nice complement to the food!

So I had lunch here today. I guess I was not disappointed, but at the same time it was not overly memorable. I just cant get my head around going to a mexican restaurant and paying for chips and salsa.... I also dont like colored chips.... Call me traditional.... I had the pork tacos.... average.... I dont know, the place is not terrible in my opinion, but there are too many good restaurants around here to spend $25 a head to eat average tacos and chips and salsa.....

HORRIBLE!!!! I do not know how this place stays in business... Bland! No flavor at all and over priced! I'm from Houston so my Mexican food standards are high.  I will NEVER come back to this place :(

The restaurant was curiously empty when we went at 7:00 on a Sunday night.  When we got our food I knew why!  The special, pulled pork and green chilli stew was greasy and had more potatoes than either pork or green chillis.  The enchiladas were marginally edible.   The final insult was when we were charged 7.50 for chips and salsas .  The chips were good, the only good thing about this meal.  This used to be a great restaurant but obviously something has changed.  Take a pass on this one.
First time here. Pumpkin porter was good and holy shit. Donkey nachos. Amazing. When I cone back will be back here again

This is one of the worst restaurants in the city; not even worthy of 1 star.  The rice is instant and made from a box.  The tortillas are store bought and the fish in the tacos are comparable to the fish from a box at Fry's.  It's a complete shame that a resort like the Boulders would associate their name with such a terrible restaurant. I've had better Mexican food on a food truck!

(Review for the Scottsdale Road location)  The Spotted Donkey is a semi-upscale Mexican restaurant with absolutely delicious food and great-tasting drinks (especially the signature margaritas). I really like the atmostphere and decor -- you can go in jeans or make it a lovely date night.   The only thing that's holding me back from four stars is the price. I'll admit - I'm a bit of a cheapskate, so the prices might not bother you as much. But here's an example of something I find a bit over the top. They offer a delicious tableside chopped salad for lunch. However, it comes with bacon. Want to add chicken or shrimp (hey, even offer to substitute for the bacon if I'm feeling especially diet-conscious?) -- the salad now becomes nearly $15. For a salad. For lunch.  Again, I know this is Scottsdale and the Spotted Donkey is a bit more upscale than, say, Zipps around the corner. So, definitely go there. (I have paid for this expensive salad more than once, and I probably will again.) Just be prepared to spend a bit more than your average lunch/dinner/happy hour.

As a proud Mexican man I hope they build the wall quickly, to stop Americans calling this Mexican food. We waited over 1 hr for our food to arrive and what was served was greasy fajitas that featured an anorexic chicken, 1 pound of uncooked peppers and kid size tortillas. I don't mind waiting for things I love, like cock fights and running water, but I would not wait 1 minute for this slop.

On the drive up to the Spotted Donkey, I asked my friend who was driving "So is this place in Flagstaff or what?". As we joked about how distant this restaurant is from our far far away land (Tempe), my stomach started to grumble. You see, I didn't eat anything that day, and my friend assured me that I would be rewarded by the amazing food at the Spotted Donkey. I took his word for it, and off we went... Though, If we didn't make it to Spotted Donkey soon, I was going to stop at the In n Out at Frank Lloyd Wright and the 101. Luckily he assured me it wouldn't be much longer, and we made it before my stomach rebelled against me.  It was a beautiful evening out, and the weather was perfect, so naturally we wanted to eat outside. As I combed over the menu, I knew exactly what I wanted. I was going to start with the Guacamole ($10.50), and for my entree I would get the Big Ol' Jack Ass Angus Burger ($12.50 - appropriate name, you'll see shortly enough).   The guacamole was some of the most tasty and fresh I have ever eaten. The mixed basket of yellow and blue corn tortilla chips complimented the guacamole immensely. The only thing missing from this great dish was the kick I am used to. I asked our server for a side of chopped jalapenos, which once mixed in to our guacamole, transformed this dish from great to sheer awesome.   I was hit with the unfortunate truth that it may be hard to top such an amazing appetizer. I only ordered a hamburger from a menu with many specialties on it. Though I was shocked again, the burger that I received was one of the tastiest I have had in Arizona in a long time. I was told by my friend that the chefs here vary on the burger cooking temperature, so I made sure to describe exactly how I wanted my burger cooked, so we went with medium +. To continue with that night's spice theme, I asked for a side of green chiles to put on my burger, which turned out to be another great choice. The burger comes with a mountain of fresh cut fries filled to the brink in a basket. These are also delicious.   While I hear they have fantastic desserts, I was beyond stuffed, and could not even consider looking at a dessert menu.  The Spotted Donkey receives an easy 5 stars in regards to our food. The only rating that they lose on is the service. The two times I have been here, the waiters have lacked personality, have been spotty at best, and seemed to have a bit of a smug attitude. I realize I am a college age student, but my money is just as green as anyone else there.   I am looking forward to my next trip up!

Absolutely love the beer braised beef enchiladas with red and green chili. I get it almost every time.  The pork stew is really good and my husband really enjoyed the chili relleno. Great mexican food and a wonderful patio, lots of umbrellas.

Been here three times now and loved it every time.  We ordered the chips and salsa as an appetizer and were glad we did.  Great chips and the tomatillo/avocado salsa was perfect.  I also really enjoyed the bean dip.  I have ordered both the shrimp and tilapia tostadas and the Chicken Rojo and would highly recommend either.  Service was the right  combination of friendly and efficient and they played good music, old time-y style country (don't worry, for those of you not into country, it wasn't too loud.)  Nice lighting, nice atmosphere.  We think we're pretty lucky to have a place like the Spotted Donkey Cantina in our neighborhood.  Stop by and you will see why.      PS: They have nice outdoor seating as well.

The Spotted Donkey is a great restaurant.   The food is consistently good and the staff are always great. The donkey paintings through out the restaurant are a lot of fun. The only down side I see with the restaurant is the pricing. It's a little pricey for what you get.
Fresh food, great presentation,  decent price and reasonable portion sizes.  Staff was friendly and attentive.

Very helpful and nice staff  We started with the nachos with pulled pork (you might think its a bit pricey for nachos, but damn.... you get a lot of food... and its good.)  A friend ordered the Calamari... and even though I am allergic, I had to try a few pieces... it was alright...........she said she had ordered it in the past and since then she says they changed the breading and they don't deep fry it anymore. Thus it is not as good as it used to be. The smoked jalapeno dipping sauce was really good though.   The Pulled Beef Barbeque Sandwich and The Beef Enchiladas were a treat.... I really like this place. Nice location and decor also. Plus they have cute donkey pictures :)

Great guacamole! Good margaritas. Had the shrimp fajitas which were great and my mom had the nachos. She's a bit if a connoisseur and really liked them. Service left a bit to be desired, but were we in the bar.

If you have ever had hatch green chili you know that it is by far the best green chili in the world.  This restaurant has multiple recipes that include some hatch.  I recommend the Mac and cheese or the enchiladas both were outstanding.

Here for dinner in April and had taken friends from east coast to lunch in February.  Never a problem with seating even when crowded.  Nice outdoor area. Everyone loved their food, but made traditional mexican choices.  Their guacamole is luscious and prickly pear margaritas very tasty.  Reliable favorite.

We live right down the road and frequent the place often. It's always been one of our favorites. We went and sat in the bar last week and received terrible service from the bartender. We sat at a table next to the bar. He took our order for drinks, we received our chips and then he took our meal order, all was good. I got the burger, (yes it's very good at a Mexican joint) and it was over cooked. My wife's meal was fine. It did get a bit busy and I understand that as I am in the restaurant business. If you're in the industry you know to not let customers water go empty! He finally came over and asked how everything was, as I began to tell him how my burger was he noticed that we had no drinks and interrupted me by walking off vs asking then listening. The manager on duty, can't remember her name, maybe Susan came over and asked how everything was. As I began to tell her how my burger was and that we had been waiting on drinks for a bit the bartender decided it was a good idea to confront me and say "we got busy". He and I were not having a conversation and the manger did notice his condescending and rude outburst and said she would report him. He then looked at her and said as he walked away "I will let you handle this!" Wow, extremely unprofessional. The manager apologized and was very sincere about everything. She did an amazing job making sure she could do whatever she could to please us. I commend her for that. She may be the only reason we come back but I doubt it. We have another spot we get great service at.

We were staying at the Boulders Resort for a weekend getaway and the resort staff suggest this restaurant. We started with the ceviche and the queso.  The ceviche was good but a little heavy on the cilantro. The queso came out way too hot to eat and separated as it cooled.   For the entree, we wanted to split the carne asada. I find it odd that the server ask me how we wanted it prepared. Now I am an AZ native and this is the first time I have ever been asked how I wanted my carne asada prepared. When it came out it was raw with little carne favor. Sent it back and the next plate was over cooked, chewy and not good.   Service was good but food left us going back the the resort for more beer to mask the bad food.

My friend and I went for the Margaritas. It was nice that our server was so knowledgable in Tequila that he opened our minds to try something new.  We ordered food and we definitely could have shared. The portions are worth every penny. We had such a great time we went back the next night.

Shockingly disappointed!  We went to SDC last night for dinner.  Good meal as usual until it came to the bill.  It would appear as though the Spotted Donkey now has a mandatory 20% gratuity for a party of 5 or more.  This came as a bit of a surprise even though we typically tip 18%-20% for their good service.  What was really surprising was that our "party of 5" consisted of 3 adults, a 4 year old and a 20 month old.  What was a satisfying meal of a sudden became marginal.

Love this place. They honored happy hour for my wife and I with our baby in the dining room. Something that Upper Crust on Cave Creek refused to do, that pizza place has horrible service. Spotted Donkey has super nice and pleasant people. The food is outstanding. Happy hour prices are amazing. Margaritas are superb. One of my favorite happy hours and Mexican restaurants. Try the happy hour taquitos.

I love to read reviews from everybody complaining about the drive to Carefree.    I feel your pain when I go to a Dbacks game  I live a couple miles down Carefree Highway but in 3 years had never stopped here at the Donkey ..but we went    Maybe you have heard the weather in AZ is glorious 9 months of the year and many restaurants have wonderful outdoor seating     So we cruised up the road thinking about dinner and at the bar we just had drinks and chips with the fundido.  Then we were full.  Next time we had drinks and an appetizer and we were full and left.    Everything tasty.   The  drinks were weak, but I like them strong enough to make me scared driving home.   Mac and cheese is tasty.  I'm going Wednesday for lunch.  I will try to get an entree.   Someone mentioned they didn't like the crowd.  This isn't old town Scottsdale. It is almost Carefree next to an expensive resort.   So no rap music or skanks.   Older folks with money! Worth a visit if you're in town.  If you're staying at the Boulders ask for doubles and stagger back to your room.
Great service. Great food. If you're staying at the Boulders, this is a no brainier. The appetizers, entrees and desserts were all good. The server was on his A game for our party of 9.
Loved this place! Chef Doug and the bartender Jill were so nice. Food was great too. Highly recommend it!

I was very disappointed in the food here, especially for what I paid for it. I ordered the stuffed pepper (for lack of better term) that was supposed to have meat, rice, cheese along with a few other things. And all I got was a pepper stuffed with rice and a few scraps of meat. I was hoping they would redeem themselves with dessert. They said all their deserts fed two easily, and for 9 bucks I would hope so. So we ordered the fried icecream. And got a small scoop of fried icecream drowning in whipped cream. So basically paid $9 for whipped cream. Very disappointed and never going back or recommending this place to anyone ever.
Always have great food!  We started going to the Spotted Donkey 3 years ago and have never had a bad meal.  We make it our go to place when we have guests in town knowing they won't be disappointed!

We first visited the Spotted Donkey three years ago and ate there twice while we were in town. Just last week we were back in Scottsdale and this was the first restaurant we went to. The food has always been good and it was last week as well not to mention I really like the prickly pear margarita so if you there you've got to try one!

Enjoyed dinner here tonight. The silver coin margaritas were delicious, and strong. We had the chips with salsa trio, and one of the salsas seemed to be a ground beef and bean salsa, but was cold. It was good but the red salsa was excellent and the tomatillo was very good. Our server Lisa was prompt to come and greet, and get the drinks, and very helpful in our selections. We opted to share the cheese enchiladas with two sauces, red and green. Served hot, full of melted cheese and just the right amount of sauce, over rice. The guac on the side was delicious, I will get an order next time. The beans were smoky, hot temperature and just hands-down delicious. Overall a big portion so we were glad we split. We'll be back.

Came here a few days ago with some family friends. Mind you, these family friends are from the Mid West and chose this place because they heard it had "really great Mexican food". Next time I let my Windy city friends pick out a "Mexican food" place in the Arizona I have called my home for over a decade, I will think again. So, here we go. I am from Scottsdale, so I pretty much knew where it was. I agree, it isn't very well signed, but when we got there, it as pretty busy. The decor is AMAZING. What a beautiful restaurant. I was tempted to swipe things off the walls they were so gorgeous. Our server was really sweet and fun and because we were a large party, we were sat in the center of the restaurant, right by the bar. We started with drinks, where the ladies had margaritas, which were good, but very small. I like my margaritas in a MARGARITA glass, not a high ball glass. They had an interesting mix of tequila, but they weren't the best, and definitely not the best bang for your buck, for sure. The chips and salsa and guacamole were okay, but very pricey! Most Mexican restaurants GIVE you chips and salsa, for free! And, we were 8 people and they brought us a little basket of chips, which to me, made no sense. My mom and I shared the fajitas for two as our entree. They serve the beef fajitas with beef tenderloin and sausage. My mom and I both thought that was weird, so we asked for no sausage, just the beef. When it came out, our fix-ens' were great, but no rice or beans or even cheese, which is usually served with fajitas. The tortillas were amazing however, and tasted hand made. The peppers were undercooked and there was like NO MEAT in the fajitas... like, none. Maybe, my mom and I had like 5 small pieces each. The fajitas for 2 are $29!!! I didn't make a stink because I didn't recommend the restaurant, and I wasn't paying, I was being taken out. But, in the end, I would never recommend this place to anyone. There are millions of amazing Mexican restaurants in Scottsdale, it isn't worth a trip. In my line of work, I recommend a lot of restaurants to out of towners, and this place will definetly not make the cut. I guess if you want pretty decor and a decent margarita with sub par food, then its your place, but not for me.
We were turned away and told they were booked and we need a reservation. They had at least 10 open tables and outside seating. Wouldn't even put us on a wait list.
Our neighborhood favorite. Even though chef, staff, and menu have changed, it's still a special restaurant. Waiters are all consistently good. Lisa was a star last night!

Unfortunately just not very good. Not a terrible experience as the service was ok and busy place but food is marginal and price is on upper end for mex food. $11.95 for chips and guacamole... $8 for the house marg. $30 for fajitas for 2. That's all fine if it is good but sad to say most could make better mex food at home.

I had the Street Enchilladas and thought they were delicious and well prepared.  The food presentation was nice as well and lets you know someone cares about the food they are sending out of the kitchen.   Service was timely and our server was friendly.  Chips and salsa are normally included in most Mexican restaurants here in Phoenix, but we had to order them as a separate appitizer here.  That wasn't a huge surprise though considering the area of town.

Love love love their chopped salad with jalapeño dressing!! I've had it with shrimp and steak and it's amazing either way!! Work walking distance, called for pick and they had it ready with in 5 mins; which is another plus since I'm limited on my lunch hour! They also had my salad dressing and protein separated so the salad doesn't get soggy; major plus points! If u haven't already, you must check it out. Also try the jalapeño shooter the are bomb.com.  Lastly, Happy hour is fun! Sit at the bar area, chat with the bar tender, the people you come with or just watch the many TVs that are set up.
The cocktails are very expensive and they dont offer table side happy hour. The food was average as was the cocktails. Wont go back.
Went for lunch with a buddy from out of town.  Margaritas were outstanding.  Service was great and the food came out quickly.

This used to be one of our most favorite places.  We go there a lot and I am also a Concierge and I can't even begin to tell you how many people I send to them - NOT after today.  If folks want to go, of course I will book them but will NO longer recommend them.  Ordered drinks - I drink one with infused cinnamon infused tequila.  Today, I couldn't even taste the cinnamon.  When I nicely mentioned that maybe it wasn't the cinnamon tequila, the bartender (not Scott) could have cared less and said, that's it. Ok - so I drank it.  We ordered appetizer - he never came to check on us, to either ask how it was, remove the empty dish, ask if we wanted something else.  Another Server saw our empty drink glasses and went behind the bar and fixed us another one - nobody ever asked us if we wanted food - totally ignored.  So, we settled the bill and decided to go to a high top and have a regular Server take care of us.  We sat down, she brought us water and disappeared.  After close to 10 minutes waiting, we walked out.  The place wasn't crowded - there may have been 8-10 people there.    Anyway, I don't think they care but they have lost our business as a couple and anybody looking for a Mexican Restaurant venue - found another place, by chance, hands down better.

The Cantina Shooters were very good. Stuffed Jalapeno's with a cream sauce in a Shot Glass. Presentation was great. There were six of us on a Tuesday night - the place was hopping busy and everyone enjoyed their food and service from the Chili Rellenos, Cheese Enchiladas, Shrimp Tacos, Carne Asada. Some of us shared dishes - the portions are large. Also the Sopapillas with cinnamon Ice cream and whipped cream for dessert were great. Our server & hostess were very nice as we mentioned it was our first time here. Very lucky to live down the street - we will be back soon. Only negative was the wine and mixed drinks were pricey but the local draft beers are fairly priced. I imagine they have a nice happy hour and will check that out.

Nothing could be better than downing a margarita, moon-side on a warm night outside at the Spotted Donkey.   Prompt. Knowledgeable. Delicious.   I'm always hesitant eating at Mexican restaurants where the plates are strikingly beautiful and they've some how made sour cream look like an art form -- I never saw this in my travels throughout Mexico.   Anyway, the food was wickedly delicious. Spicy, flavorful and bold -- perfection combination on a plate. I'd definitely order the guac, ceviche and fajitas.   Even when it is 130 degrees, I'd probably still eat their hotness.
Such a shame. Had 9 of us. Two are chefs. All the food good flavor but way, way, over salted all the meals to the point we could not eat it. If they remove some of the salt we would come back ;-(

I've been here 3 times over the past month for happy hour and it's always been good. The bartenders are very friendly and funny and the food is fantastic. Jill and Tony have always been great. From "there wasn't room for us so we broke the rules and sat somewhere else" to "happy hour is dumb," sounds like there are a lot of cheap, entitled people that try and eat there for happy hour. Ignore these fake foodies who write the bad reviews and go to The Spotted Donkey. You won't regret it.

So... the waitress was ok, That's why I even gave 2 stars.    I AM BEYOND disappointed.  It's restaurant week for goodness sake, aren't you supposed to be at your best?  Lets start with the wine list, really? the most swill wine ever.  I'm no wine connoisseur, but really the cheapest wine at a not so cheap price and even though I was willing to pay for good wine, NONE was offered.   The ceviche wasn't ceviche it was shrimp in cocktail sauce.... it tasted ok,  but Ceviche it was not!!!  Have your chef google it....   I had the pork tenderloin...mediocre at best and the mole sauce was horrible.  My friend had the Carne Asada (flank steak and granted a trick to tenderize)  She had one bite, very tough.  Moving on to dessert we were trying to have a good attitude. It was presented beautifully.  The Sopapillas were good and the whipped cream was again presented beautifully,    about the time I said "the ice cream is freezer burned" my friend said my ice cream ( on her Apple Tort) is freezer burned.  TIME to go.  Sorry you guys have to step it up.

I've been here many times but this experience really made it difficult to go back.  The food here is pretty good, the jalapeno pepper poppers are terrific.  The Spotted Donkey Salad with Salmon, which you have to ask for, is really above par.  BUT, they charge for chips and salsa, not normal in a mexican place.  Worst though was the way they took advantage tonight.  I went over for one drink at the bar, "what kind of good Bourbon do you have?", "Blantons", Great give me a Blantons neat, rocks on the side.   Got the drink, that's all I wanted so I asked for my check.  Holy S*(&&, seriously.  READY!  $23.00 for ONE DRINK!.   I can buy the bottle for a little over twice that.   It's too late once you've ordered so I felt like I was had by the short hairs but it really makes it hard to go back for any of the other things.  I used to have lunch here with my wife fairly regularly, I'll suggest Venues or Legend Trail or any of a number of other options before I'll go back after getting taken advantage of with prices like that.

Ok, I am giving this place 4 stars based on the habanero margarita alone! It was amazing! Normally I have to instruct the bartender but they already had their own recipe. The habanero is infused in the tequila on-site. Great job! My husband and I ordered the queso dip on happy hour. Unfortunately we also had to order ground beef to add to the dip. I must say the staff was very accommodating! We sat at the bar. Overall we enjoyed the experience and are likely to visit again.

If your looking for something different. This is it. Great food. Great service. Ask for Kelly. She is a doll!! She was awesome. I am all about service and she was on point. This is a very chill place. Relaxing to bring the kids and enjoy the patio and views. Not bad. We live local and this was the first time we have been in!  We will be back.  Now the only downfall is the do not offer complimentary chips and salsa? Kinda crazy for being a Mexican food place. That was the only turn off. But it is what it is

I love this place for Happy Hour, BUT, do not go at 5pm!  We went in on Fri at 4:50 & All 6 little pub tables around the bar were taken.  There were 3 of us & the hostess wanted us to sit at the bar.  How can 3 people sitting at a bar share an appetizer, let alone have a nice conversation? They would not allow us to sit at a table & still get the Happy Hour discount.  Very Disappointed, as this place is now owned by the Boulder Resort & we would expect better serivce. Not to mention, that we Aways order dinner too!  If they are going to be this crowded during their Happy Hour, why don't they add more pub tables?  Very unfair and turned us away :(

Close walk if you're staying at The Boulders Resort!   I got the salmon tostadas (slightly fishy) and my lunch date got the beef enchiladas. For the convenience, it was a decent place to dine al fresco. Our host/the owner(?) was super friendly.    Much like Dan G's review-- Spotted Donkey offers the usual Mex-American fare. Our food was predictable but dependable.
service was on point and the food was even better, try the special tequila straight from Mexico

I am mixed about my review for here. We got there, and I made the reservation via Open Table. It was one of 2 reservation times left, so I felt like the restaurant was going to be packed. It wasn't. The inside was basically vacant, but I will say that the patio was packed. So we sat down, and it took about 10 minutes for the waiter to come over to us. Then it took another 10 minutes to get our drinks and guac/salsa brought to our table. The chips and guacamole were delicious, so there is no complaints about that. Then it took about another 10 minutes after that for our food to come out (our waiter kept vanishing and never stopping by). Once our food came out though, it was soooooo good. I got 2 shrimp tacos, which I can't find the name of now on the online menu, they were phenomenal. I highly recommend. And the side of rice that came with them was so light and fluffy. Absolutely delicious. So that is why I am so torn .. the food was amazing but the service was absolutely horrible. Oh, and the margarita was not good. It was premade in a machine and not mixed well at all.   Also, it was really hard to find. We were in Scottsdale for the week, and it was dark by the time we went to dinner. There was absolutely no signage for the restaurant on the main road, and we drove around for about 10 minutes and were about to give up when we finally found it tucked away in the corner of some business complex. No signs on the road, nothing. So that is another reason I gave it 3 instead of 4 stars.

Nice ambience. It was packed, Cinco de Mayo. But the Hostess found us a table for 2. Great Mahi Baja Tacos. John our waiter was so real, gave us great recommendations on what to get. Also great timing for everything. We heard an owl on the way to our car, then spotted it on tall tower in the dark before it flew off.
This place is so good!!  I would ride a donkey all the way from my place in Phoenix to eat the Donkey Nachos.
Gorgeous views, impossible to not like. The cute pictures on the walls of the donkeys are fun.  Try the prickly pear margarita!

I felt my dinner was yummy; I ordered the chicken and pork enchiladas with rice and beans.  Chips and salsa are extra, not complimentary like most places.   They do give you 3 types of salsa to try.  The margarita was good, just the portion was too small.  The view is amazing outside (on the second floor) and inside is clean and pleasing. Service was average.  The location is hard to find in a desolate shopping area next to the Boulders.  The restaurant is on the second floor.  Be prepared to pay $$$ it's pretty pricey.
Nachos are the best,  also, tacos are imaginative.  Highly recommend. Second story on the El Pedregal shopping center, outdoor seating available.

I will return.  Hard to see from the road but really good!  The bowl of guacamole for app. was way over priced.  That is the only complaint.  We had the quesadilla app. large enough to share for a meal which we did.  The 4 taco platter is well worth it and 2 meals in one.  The restaurant is large, patio a bit small but has heat lamps.  TVs for sports and a large bar.  Pico is amazing!  We will return.  Friendly service too.  I also forgot we had fried ice cream for dessert so save room!!

Wow!!! What a great find.  The stuffed peppers I had were awesome and NOT breaded.  They really take their tequila seriously. The Naranja Margarita was so good we asked for the recipe.  The bartender came out and told us everything from how they infuse their tequila to how they make their Margarita mix.  Our server was very knowledgable about all aspects of the menu.  Will be back very soon!!!!

I took my girlfriend there Friday Night.   The food was great and the ambiance on the patio was awesome. It's a really great place and I loved the atmosphere.  However, the service was pretty bad.  While the busboy was refilling water to the table next to us, his butt hit my girlfriends wine glass and knocked it over and literally drenched her pants, our seat, and our table was floating.   I don't think the guy even really acknowledge what happened, he grabbed is a couple napkins for us and walked away. We cleaned up the whole thing ourselves with the help of some of the other patrons.    Our waiter came back a few minutes later and seemed unaware of the situation at all or that it was the busboys fault, I think he thought we spilled it ourselves.. yes he brought us another glass of wine and that's fine.  But it would have been nice if they would have acknowledged it and tried a little harder to help fix it.   I wasn't going to make a scene so we just finished our meal, paid, and left. But it would have been nice for them to acknowledge what happened and try to help a little.. at least it was white wine..

This is one of my favorite places for a long, lazy lunch or a cozy dinner.  The restaurant has such gorgeous, inviting decor and a nice patio too.  The staff members are exceptionally friendly and competent.  And most importantly, the food and drinks are excellent in terms of taste, presentation, and variety.  Everything is very reasonably priced considering the high quality.  I believe it's one of the best restaurants in the valley.  p.s.  Although there's no gluten-free menu (yet?), they do an above-average job of accommodating my gluten-free diet.

Have been a regular for many years, but this place has been going down hill the last year both in food and service. Overpriced and average at best. The portions are about 1/3 of what they used to be but prices are the same!

This was a disappointment pretty much I will be around  1st off the hostess at some attitude not sure what her problem was set me in a really uncomfortable booth ask if she can move me to a different table she told me  No even though the places pretty empty so I got a chair moved to the  End of the table now for the food chips   Salsa Very bland very watery the green tasted like burnt  Plastic  guacamole Had 0  Flavor  Tasted like something you get from Subway I  Ordered the chimi changa  I like the meat that was in it   was nice and tender the red and green sauce was not good the red tasted burnt the green was ok but to greasy our server was friendly but  Wasn't very  Attentive probly will never go back

Our hosts for the weekend took us here for lunch and I'm so glad they did. GREAT food!  We were all starving so before our hostess could seat our party of 4, we had two orders of chips and guacamole and a round of top shelf margaritas ordered. The drinks were delivered right away and the chips and guacamole shortly followed. Chips and guacamole hit the spot and so did the margarita!  We all ended up ordering the same item; chicken enchiladas that came with spanish rice and black beans.  A pretty standard and typical item on a mexican restaurants menu but I have to say, it was very tasty and was prepared well.  The chicken was not dry at all. We all over indulged in chips and guac so finishing our entrees would be next to impossible. We had lots of leftovers, for sure.   We came on a Saturday afternoon right during the lunch rush hour but it wasn't busy at all. This allowed for our meals and drinks to come out rather quickly. We were in and out in an hour. Pretty quick lunch, I'll say...

My friends and I went into Spotted Donkey one SLOW afternoon. We left due the lack of services and the utterly rude waitress. Not to mention the the bland food! Spotted Donkey should be ashamed of how they treated us!  I will never return, and I will also let EVERYONE  in the industry know how RUDE and how unprofessional they were.

Two of us ordered something wrapped in a flour tortilla. Had four small strips of grilled beef inside. Some tasty sauce, too. But the pillow sized flour tortilla was the meal. It must have started life the size of a $20 pizza. Only thicker. And still wet. And then it was wrapped around four small pieces of beef. Had to saw through it to find the grilled beef. Very disappointed. Spendy tortilla. Have no idea if other menu items are good or bad but the couple we were with were unhappy too.

Mahi Mahi fish tacos are excellent. Love the enchiladas because you get hatch green chile (the best) and red chile. Margaritas are also awesome. Ask for Josh as your waiter, native AZ and very friendly.

Excellent Mexican food, good atmosphere. Bartenders are so personable, especially Tony, Jill and Scott. Very fun talking with all the patrons from across the US. One of a kind place. Located in the best part of the Phoenix Valley!

So me and my boyfriend read about this place in the Phoenix magazine and decided to give it a try...punched in the address in the gps and started driving, we had no idea how far it was and we got there an hour later...we got a seat pretty quick for a saturday night and its a really cute little restaurant. We ordered the nachos, which by the way were the best nachos ive ever had, my boyfriend got the burger and i got the chalupas. Everything was amazing very tasty and flavorful food...The service was slow but over all this place was awesome i just wish it  was a little bit closer, unless im in the area driving from chandler is a bit of a drive =(

Way above Mexican for a Mexican food fan that finds El Encanto very average (with Margaritas that taste like cheap frozen mix to add insult to malpractice).  As in all places we dine as a twosome we are bar eaters...and the bartenders are top notch and social.  The key baseline Mexican food metrics---salsa, chips, guac, margarita, all pass with flying colors...significantly above average.  They have some unique dishes like a Mexican stew that is superb...my go to dish. Have been disappointed with Chile relleno and some average dishes...but again relative to El Encanto it's better in all respects.  Will return...but do find Hacienda down the street superior quality and flavors. Close to home makes it a good choice

Went here with family and the food was not bad! Decent mexican and not overly priced! Chips and salsa should always be free at a restaurant tho. Overall i gave it a 4 star for being decent with good service and food.

This place was really fun.  it's in a mall, and doesn't look like much from the outside.  Several other restaurants were dead, but this restaurant was packed, and for good reason.  The atmosphere was fun, the service was great, and the food was a step up from the usual mexican place.  It's not fancy food by any stretch - it's just high quality and prepared with care.  The cocktails weren't cheap, but they didn't leave us feeling let down.  The Mezcal Mule was the popular drink of the evening.

Love this place! Had a great rum/ grapefruit cocktail, so good. The shrimp on skewers appetizer we get every time. Really big meaty shrimp. I had the mahi mahi tacos, divine. One of our regular go to places.

You'll notice, if you stay at the Boulders at the very tip top of Scottsdale, that there are not very many food choices to be had. A food desert in the actual desert. Weird. Of the choices that are available, you are left wondering which are actually OK and which are just plain crap.  This place, which has a great name, is in the OK category. If you are not careful, you'll drive right past it and get stuck at another restaurant you didn't want to visit. It's located on the top floor of what seems like a deserted "only in Arizona" designed strip mall. After a little bit of exploring, we found it and entered into an atmosphere that is distinctly southwestern. All average so far.  The average continued. Margaritas were good, but overpriced. Food was good by overpriced. The queso, which my partner in crime reported was the best of her life, was just that. The service was absent with occasional sprinkles of attentiveness. We walked out with a $60 bill for 2 people and wondered what the hell we had just eaten.  You could go elsewhere, yes, but if you get lost and actually happen to find this place in the zombie apocalypse that is North Scottsdale, then you will probably have the best average experience of your life.

We just returned from having lunch at Spotted Donkey Cantina and it was pretty good, except for a couple things.  The lettuce in the little salad that came with my enchiladas had obviously come out of a bag because it tasted terrible.  I had one bite and regretted it because it ruined the taste of my bite of enchilada.  The lettuce even had brown on it.  It wasn't good and would cause me to think twice about returning.  My husband had the Cascabel-Chile Marinated Carne Asada and it had good flavor but the meat was over cooked somewhat.  This restaurant does have a nice atmosphere and would probably be fun when there are lot of people there.  It was very quiet when we were there for lunch.

Now that we live in Carefree permanently we  have looked forward to eating  at the Spotted Donkey. Have not been there for a few years. I am sad to say that they r not what they use to be. They use to have awesome Margaritas. Now they taste like over sweet store bought mix. Can't even taste the tequila so what's the point? The customer service is great! Not hovering yet checking in to make sure we r ok. The food is good but it is not consistently good. Last time I went I had the steak and shrimp burrito which me happy. The time before that wasn't so great and there was hardly anyone there. Please make a killer Margarita again!! Would like to find other Mexican restaurants so I have more options.
3 stars for the service, 2 stars for the food :( I think there are plenty of other locations outside of the resort to try before I would go back here

My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place on Saturday and had a GREAT lunch here! It's a little pricier than what we would usually spend on lunch, but well worth it. They have a nice patio with umbrellas. We chose to sit outside, but inside was very welcoming as well. We had the queso to start, and WOW. I highly recommend this appetizer. The skinny margaritas were delicious ($10 a pop, but still delicious). Service was phenomenal. Can't wait to go back!

We made reservations for dinner and after looking at pictures from fellow reviewers we had a general idea of what to expect and order. Our server was very friendly, offered suggestions on what to order. The best part was when we decided to have the nachos for apps, she mentioned it was enough to be dinner. We are glad she did, we still had leftovers. The nachos were delicious, the combination of different salsas on each quarters was the best as they complimented the flavors and texture. There was pork carnitas a plenty! We were pleasantly surprised at the amount of meat they had in the nachos.   We also ordered the shrimp ceviche, it was refreshing and perfection with the balance of flavors spicy and cooling.   The decor is very fun, makes for good photo opps.

We were torn on coming here because of the reviews but it worked out, I would recommend it, especially if you're staying at the Boulders Resort (they will drive you there on a golf car). I'm guessing they might have read the reviews and addressed the problems.  Our service was great (went there 3 days over a 6 day visit). The food was a little overpriced (it's part of the Waldorf Asotria, so I kind of expected that, but charged it back to my room to get the HHonors points).  While it wasn't the best Mexican food I've ever had, it was tasty and good.  The atmosphere is casual and friendly.

Let's see. Yes, it's in an eerily disused convention area. But the complaints don't make a lot of sense to me beyond that. It's technically part of the Boulders so they are all about customer service and making sure you're happy with what you have. Don't like a drink or your food? they'll rush to fix it (Not that we had problems at all, beyond one too-sweet margarita that was a matter of taste and they happily fixed). They have barrel aged cocktails they made themselves, are thrilled to talk about, and are happy to let you sample.Their food is fresh, light (unless you order something fried and then really, that's on you, lol), and flavorful. the locals are friendly and the decor is nice. We had a great time 2 nights in a row. The staff was all excellent, the only names we got were Scott and Jill, who were amazing, plus a (forgive me) bearded young gentleman behind the bar whose name we didn't get but who was a delight and very helpful. A really generous happy hour tops it off--that's what kept us coming back. Thanks guys!

$88 bill, for 3 tiny margaritas (if they had tequila in them, none of us could tell), 2 quesadillas, that came with 2 small tablespoons of guacamole and sour cream on a bed of what they call Pico De Gayo; it didn't have any peppers in it, and a Chilli Relleno plate. 15 minutes after we were served,  I had to go into the restaurant and find someone to bring us some salsa; this mexican food place does not offer chips and salsa like others do, you have to pay for it (they did not charge us for the requsted salsa though). All in all, the only thing special about this place was the over priced no-frilles menu, and the nice back patio.

I honestly hate going to Scottsdale.. Yes, everything is so beautiful but I love the city.. I love people and clutter on the streets and buildings that make you feel sick when you look up. However, I love Spotted Donkey. And although my parents have been wanting us to take another family trip out there, I think Spotted Donkey is what would do it for me.   I have never had this kind of cuisine taste so darn good - southwestern western. It's just sooo incredible and the way they manipulate mexican food with different flavors and ingredients is absolutely amazing. I ordered the Enchiladas and it was the best enchilada I have ever had!!! The chicken was so juicy and the fact that they didn't use a tortilla, but rather a sort of thicker and softer wrap made everything a hot gooey mess!!!  I also tried the signature tacos, fajitas and chimichanga. All very very veryyyy good!! Only thing is that I wish they would serve free salsa and chips, just because that is the first thing I look forward to when I eat mexican food. However, we ordered the guacamole and it was so fresh and very well seasoned!!  As for margaritasssss, I ordered the prickly pear - my personal Scottsdale favorite whenever I visit. Actually, anything prickly pear does it for me!!   Since my experience at Spotted Donkey, I've been on a mission to find the perfect enchilada that will even come CLOSE to what I experienced at this place.. but it's pretty tough.

I enjoyed the chopped salad very much. We got the shrimp appetizer and it was spicy but very good. The service is precise and not pushy or rushed. The music is nice, the faculties are clean and overall the restaurant feels like it's new.  I would like to go here for dinner and see what the crowd is like. I will definitely be back.

Sometimes, you just experience a perfect moment, and I had one at this place!    We went to El Pedregal to check it out on a typical early November Scottsdale day - which is to say, absolutely gorgeous weather!   I've only been to El Pedregal once before, and it was a ghost-town - but that was at the height of the summer with temps in the high 90s or more.  This time it was high 70s, and there was a music/wine festival going on, with good live music and lots of happy people ... the atmosphere could not have been better.    We saw the Spotted Donkey and managed to get a table outside on the patio, which was full.  I felt like I'd died and gone to heaven right then ... sitting in a gorgeous setting, with views of mountains, palm trees, blue skies ... being waited on by nice folks, surrounded by happy patrons ... it was just ideal.  Then we got the food.  To my surprise, it was all good ... the chips and salsa (pretty expensive, when most places give the stuff away) were both great - 'perfect' chips, and the tomatilla salsa was to die for.  My main course (stuffed pepper) was awesome!  I just can't describe how good it was. I've become so jaded by Mexican restaurants, growing to loath the big plates, piles of beans, piles of rice, goopy sauce on everything ... this meal was refreshing, delightful.    I'm really looking forward to coming back, maybe next time for dinner; my biggest fear is - it will be dead ... I'm not sure what kind of traffic these guys get on a typical evening - but I will give it one shot.

Outstanding!!! Don't listen to the winey reviews. This place has the best tasting Southwestern food that I have ever tried. I have been a chef for more decades than I care to recall and I can honestly tell you that the chef here puts love into his food. The sauces have the depth of flavor that you would normally only find at your grandma's home. This is my "go to" place when I hunger for full service, fine dining Southwest cuisine.
Agree that the jalapeno shooters are a must....the steak and shrimp burrito was also excellent....and they have a margarita made with habanero infused tequila! All in all the food was excellent.

Not the same level of service or quality of food, as in the past. Disappointed now for the last time.  Went for happy hour recently and establishment had a problem because we took a table literally next to the bar but not in the bar.  We were a party of 6.  All our tabs together amounted to $180.    Not sure why we got such an attitude from the bartender.  The only reason I gave 2 stars is the waitress who took over was very polite

How good is this place? We went two night in a row on vacation!!!! Who does that? First- the queso is the best maybe ever. But the real winner is the chocolate cake. It's the best we have ever eaten. I am going to dream about it. I may actually just move. Sooooooooooo worth it.

We really liked this place. Nice ambiance, though a bit touristy...as you might expect being next to The Boulders. Tried a selection of appetizers -- not as spicy as we prefer, but yummy...we liked all but the queso fundido, which was just OK. Margaritas were also delish. Surprised to read others reporting lousy service -- we had a good experience. It's on the list.

I am honestly shocked by the high reviews of this place. When there are so many fabulous Mexican food restaurants in Arizona, do NOT waste your money here.   The pros:  1. Neat decor and location  The cons:  1. Chips and salsa for $7.00!!!! Are you kidding me? You get them free at almost every other Mexican food restaurant. That should have been my warning sign.  2. The rest of the food was outrageously expensive.    3. The quality of this over-priced food was sub-par at best. I had the fajitas and they were just not good.   4. The bathroom sink was very unique and after taking a few minutes to discover where the water was actually coming from I found that the water was actually passing over BLACK MOLD! This was enough to make me want to vomit since I had washed my hands before eating my not so good fajitas.  5. A 20% gratuity was added on our bill. I felt that was a bit presumptuous. 15% is acceptable for a gratuity then let me add more if I want to. 20% is not a given.   6. This is petty, but they spelled "chipotle" wrong on one of their menu items.  Overall, I was very disappointed in this place. There are so many great, award winning Mexican food restaurants in Scottsdale alone, why waste your money here? I won't return.

Our waitress, Kelley, is darling and sweet!! She is a fantastic waitress, in that she is ebullient, efficient and effective!!! Our fajitas were yummy and filling!! Guacamole was perfect!  Thanks Kelley!!!
I love the Spotted Donkey!  Try the nachos - yum!

I am surprised that this is not a more well known place.. The food is full of flavor.. Everything I have had there is well prepared. This is a destination spot for us since we have to drive from Central Phoenix to eat here.
Service was good. Food was ok. Chips stale. Not recommended with so many other options for Mexican food in the area.
So disappointed. Used to be fabulous. Great ambiance and service, but food is mediocre at best and way too expensive. Hope it gets back to where it was. Very $ for quality.
Something has changed here... Food sucks... Very expensive ... Don't waste your money here

I have to say, I'm not a fan. The food was pretty tasteless. I had the shrimp and beef burrito. Boring. My husband had the fillet fajitas, he said they were the worst he ever  had. The flan and the fried ice cream were a bit better. I'm giving this place two stars because the beer was good.
Like his spotted brother - "he kick's ass" - great food, awesome atmosphere.  Don' t miss the guac and the nachos.  I'd get on the back of this "ass" anytime.

The crowd here is totally not my scene, but you have to appreciate great ambiance and incredible food. It's a haul up to this place from where I live, even when I lived in north Scottsdale, but totally worth it. There are few cooler places to be in the Valley than a warm night on the patio here.  The inside is very New Mexican, with a totally rustic full bar that has been packed every time I've come in. I even skip my usual drink of choice to order the Scottsdale Cocktail (yup, friggin' awful name, but the citrusy goodness in this glass is just too hard to resist).   The food? Some of the best carne asada I've ever had. It comes with an avocado tomatillo sauce that is literally blissful. The honey glazed salmon is also a delight, with an interesting mix of sweet, tangy and just a bit of kick. Though it's kind of BS that they don't bring chips and salsa to the table -- shouldn't be surprised in this neighborhood, but still -- order the chips and salsa trio anyway. It's worth the extra cash for this trio of awesome sauces.

Meh. I did not love this place. Bartenders were great. I'd go back if I wanted to chat with them.   The house margarita (premix) was super sweet. The jalapeño popper shooters were not served to us a shooters (they were out of shot glasses), but on a plate.   My enchiladas (beef and pork) tasted good. BUT, to me, the meat tasted like pot roast. Like home cooked pot roast that Grandma serves. Good, but not really my ideal Mexican craving.

Went to the Boulders on a Thursday for an overnight stay for our anniversary. We didn't want to do anything fancy, so we chose to go the the Spotted Donkey for a laid back and hopefully fun atmosphere. First impression was it was old and dirty. Not busy at all. Plenty of open tables. Hostess okay but sat us at the only two top with an uncomfortable cement bench in a corner right next to two other people, and the table was extremely wobbly. It took 5 minutes for anyone to come over and when we asked if we could move to any of the many open tables, our waiter had to disappear in the back for over 5 minutes to "see" if we could move. Seriously? When they finally moved us and our waiter came back, we asked about the seasonal infused liquor that was referenced on the menu. He told us all that was offered was a tequila. We asked what it was infused with and he told us it had been in a barrel for about a month. We tried to get him to understand what infused meant, fruit herbs etc, but he had not clue. Finally gave up. Asked about the sangria and it also was infused but he again could not tell us with what, so I went with the white sangria and hoped for the best. My husband went with a plain margarita because we had no idea what else there was. At this point we really were a little hesitant to stay there, but as it was our anniversary we were trying to stay positive. So we decided to start with the grilled romaine and roasted tomato wedge salad to share. How bad can a salad be? Bad. When it arrived, I immediately could tell it was romaine I would have thrown away. It was very dark green and extremely woody. You could barely cut it up with the knife. We literally had a bread plate full of romaine pieces that were inedible, and the stem (the piece that comes out of the ground) was also still attached. After that we decided not to chance dinner. We flagged down our waiter (who had been very elusive the entire time we were there) and asked for the bill. We went back to the main lobby and got an Uber and went to El Encanto. It was a night and day difference with atmosphere, service and food. But what a disappointment that a place like the Boulders would have a restaurant with such poor quality and service. Would not recommend to anyone for any reason. Go to Taco Bell . You'll be happier.
Great atmosphere and we really like the jalapeños poppers, the margaritas, and the pork chimichanga
Very cute place! The chips and salsas are delicious and we ordered the taquitos.... Yum!  Great mimosas, as well.

I decided to try the Happy Hour on Friday afternoon. The staff was immediately friendly, attentive without being invasive and genuinely appeared to be enjoying their jobs and eachother. The atmosphere is relaxed but elegant and upper class. They have a daily happy hour 3-6 with an appetizer menu of items all for 4 dollars, discounts on some signature drinks, 6 dollar wines and 5 dollar mixed drinks, plus a deal on beer too. I ordered the machaca spring rolls and omg, they were divine! the sauce accompanying them was out of this world yummy and the garnish was lovely and tasty. I'm looking forward to going back and not breaking the bank at the same time.

This place was so good we went twice...and I wish they had food like that up here in Calgary because I've never had calamari like that or the jalapeño shooters.....mexican food heaven!  Okay on our first trip there we all had the calamari and instead of your usual rings and tentacles they did it like chicken fries - sticks!  They came amazingly tender (no chewy seafood texture), with an amazing chipotle sauce we all held onto to go with our main courses, and a fresh roasted tomato/cilandro dip.  For my main I had the chili relleno, which was baked with rice inside (something I've never had before), with roast pork and cheeses mixed in.  It had a little tomato sauce, two corn tortilla rounds, and it was so good I ate till I hurt.  badly.  The walk to the car for the 5 min drive back down the road to where we were staying was rough, but totally worth it.  The white sangria was very light and refreshing especially next to such a heavy meal.  On our second trip our server John was fantastic.  D and I shared a plate of Jalapeño Shooters which were so good I cleaned out my little shot glasses (when its so good you have to lick your fingers clean you know it's worth it).  The jalapeños were definitely fresh because of the sheer spiciness of them (they lose their oomph when they sit too long in a grocery store as opposed to homegrown/fresh off the plant).  We'd had to wait for our order because their quality control was so good that John apologized to us for having to hold our order of shooters - the tips had been burnt and he wouldn't bring the first run out to us.  I have no problem waiting with staff who will catch cooking accidents like that rather than serving them.  I honestly appreciate that kind of quality control and wish more places were as diligent...  I tried the red sangria this time which was refreshing and absolutely loved it.  Since mom had had the fajitas on our first trip I thought I'd try the shrimp ones this time for my main course.  They came out sizzling hot, smoking a little, and you couldn't touch the plate they were on because the cast iron was ridiculously hot.  The tortillas were too hot to touch at first so those need to cool a little before you fill them, but they were soft and tasty, and I got extras because the first 4 aren't nearly enough for the amount of shrimp, peppers and onions they give you.  Ate so much my stomach hurt...again!  And yet we still made room for the banana wraps for dessert this time.  Delicious!  All in all, I wish they had this place in Calgary instead...I'd have trouble not going for dinner every day...!

Drove up from Tucson and spent a weekend at the Boulders for my birthday. Came here one of the nights for dinner. The ambiance was so fun and lively, especially during a U of Arizona game! Service was great.  My boyfriend has sampled carne asada far and wide in Arizona, and said the carne asada here was the best that he has ever had! I normally am not a fan of carne asada, and even I had to admit it was ridiculously good. It had a perfect crisp and slight char on the outside that really made it outstanding. That meal will be unforgettable for him!  I enjoyed a gigantic bowl of pork chile verde. It was quite heavy as expected, but a tad on the salty side, but I took almost 3 nights of leftovers all the way home to Tucson, added some sour cream, and it was perfect :)  Trio of salsas to start as an appetizer. I would not get this if you're expecting that classic, chunky, tomato-based salsa that you get at the grocery store. Yuck! These were flavorful and inventive salsas, and more liquid than your store-bought salsas, which I've gotten used to while living in Arizona.  We both enjoyed the margaritas! Till next time!

We love this place.  The calamri tenderloin is incredible and   Outdoor patio is awesome and the food is hearty but creative.unique.  The baracoa chimis are awesome.  The chips with three dips is also great.  Only knock is that iti is a little expensive.  We asked for chips with dip and guacomole and they brought our two bowls of chips and it was over $20 because they sent out two orders.  Most dishes are around $15.

My friends and I used to love this place but the recent changes have been unfortunate. The menu is smaller and more expensive than it was in the past and the food is extremely overpriced for what it is. Staff is always friendly and talkative and the location is great. Their patio dining is one of the best in north Scottsdale and the surrounding area is beautiful. Overall a good place for happy hour or a nice dinner but be prepared to pay for it.
We've been here for happy hour a couple times but it's been a while since we had a meal.  Drinks and dinner were very good.  Service was attentive and friendly.

Underwhelmed. After years of our friends telling us this is their favorite place we decided as we are new to the area to try the spotted D.  No 2.5 stars on Yelp so I'll be generous because it wasn't bad or good  Staff hands down were great all except possibly at the end of the evening.  The manager seemed to run past our table asking if everything was ok... leaving before we had a chance to reply.... actually it wasn't.   First Mexican restaurant I have been in where they don't bring you chips and salsa as you sit down.   Nor do they have any salsa for your meal.  You might thing I shouldn't need it, but we both found out dishes bland and lacking any kind of Mexican flavor.  We were served a couple of dishes that contained ingredients that we told up front we couldn't eat.  Staff handled this very well.   Pork Stew has a great description but no taste. Despite having hatch chillies on the list the only evidence of hatch chillies was the hard skin found in amongst the 75% potatoes.   Atmosphere was nice, plenty of outdoor seats and great decor.  Place was about half full of people but not worth returning for us. Plenty more chillies in that local sea.    Sad part was to see the failing tax break that used to be El Pedrigal.   The Spotted D is the only thing left now other than conference rooms.   From looking at the credit card statement it appears that the HOA owns the Spotted D. So not sure of the arrangement there.

I'm on the fence between 3-4 stars, but for food quality I'm going with 4.  Service and value for the money would be closer to 3.  The décor is very charming, although as others have mentioned, the shopping plaza where its located is mostly deserted which is a bit strange.  For the prices and the fact that its part of the Boulders resort, I would have expected better service.  It wasn't bad, just not very attentive. The menu is fairly small and they don't provide the usual chips and salsa, so don't walk in there hungry!  The tacos were very good as was the salad with chicken.  Not sure I'd rush back, but if you're in the area its not a bad place.
Superb. Would highly recommend the beef barbacoa tacos and a hand crafted traditional margarita to go along with it. Tony, the bartender, kept the drinks coming!

What a great place.  Did a search on yelp and once again I wasn't disappointed.   A little out of the way but we'll worth the drive North of Phoenix.   Menu selections were abundant and happy hour specials were a real deal.

This place is delicious! We ordered the donkey nachos after reading yelp reviews. They were delicious and filling. We ended up splitting an entree bc they were so filling. We got the chicken enchiladas which I'm still dreaming about
Love their food, patio, and of course, the prickly pear frozen margarita.  Perfect end to our long hike up in Carefree.

Wow. Not sure where to begin, but bottom line avoid this place at all costs if you are looking for good food, good service, and what you would expect from a restaurant connected with such a 5-Star hotel like the Boulders. We ordered shrimp fajitas and the shrimp were the size of a quarter like the frozen ones you get from the grocers freezer.
I have eaten here about a dozen times.  House margaritas and jalapeno poppers are my favorite.  I wish it was closer to my house.

This is the good Spotted Donkey! We really liked other one before the ownership change, very much so disliked it after the ownership change, and are so happy to have found this one. The menu is full of great Tex Mex-with-a-fancy-twist-foods. Prices are a little higher than normal Mexican food however you actually get more quality and freshness for it. It's a great place to come for date night, a casual weeknight meal, or a family dinner.

Where did the famous donkey from the movie "Shrek" go when he retired?  He took those royalty checks and invested them in a very tasty Mexican restaurant called "The Spotted Donkey" in Carefree, AZ. (Disclaimer--I am joking about the Shrek donkey, although I bet he comes here for dinner)!  We were fortunate to have reserved a Friday night table early, as those before us who came to see the hostess without reservations looking morose and ended up checking their smartphones for other dining options.  Our waiter was attentive and helpful, explaining that the enchiladas in mole sauce had gone off the menu about 6 months earlier, due to a general lack of popularity.  While this did not give us much cause for optimism for the palates of the restaurant's clientele, our waiter assured us there were other tasty options on the menu.  We made an investment in an expensive appetizer, chips with homemade guacamole.  My stocks should pay these kind of dividends--it was delicious.  For dinner items, my bride ordered a burro with steak and shrimp.  She could only make her way through half of it before waving the white flag.  I ordered two machaca chicken enchiladas, smothered in red and green chili sauces, with sides of rice and beans.  Again, these were far superior to what you would procure at a chain restaurant.  Dessert?  You have got to be kidding!  I recommend this to everyone, but do not show up at dinnertime without reservations!  Otherwise you will be spending an excessive amount of time sipping one of the Spotted Donkey's tasty margaritas.

Heard great things. Warm comfy atmosphere. Friendly service. Food good.   However, this is typical Americanized Mexican food in a dead convention area. Try Cave Creek for locally owned great food of many varieties!

The fish tacos are fantastic. Margaritas are great. The service is hit or a miss. Half the times we have come here the servers are rude or annoyed we are there and the other half they're great. I probably wouldn't go back if it wasn't for the fish tacos!

We had reservations and we were late. I hate being late but I was not in control of our group that night so there you go. But even though we were late they greeted us with a smile and still had our table waiting.    We then were greeted by the wait person, a very nice woman with a great smile. She took our drink orders and appetizers .It all came very quickly. But it did not feel we were being rushed in any way.   I honestly can not remember what we all ordered for the actual dinner. But I do know it was VERY good. I was surprised in that we have had a recent string of crappy meals in other places that this is what I was expecting. But lucky for us we all truly enjoyed our food and time.    This was a few weeks ago and it is time to go back ;-[)

I recently went here for the first time for happy hour. I have gone many times for lunch or dinner.  I didn't even know it was happy hour, but I will say, what great bar staff. Friendly, eager to point out what is on happy hour, ready to get your order going.  I was hesitant to try the jalapeño shooters again... (i only try these when someone else at my table orders them...and really I was in tears because they were so spicy). Well, hello July in Scottsdale, because it seems like the jalapeños delivered that day were not spicy! Good for me, I was able to enjoy the shooters, and see what everyone loves about them, but without tons of spice.  We didn't order tons of drinks, but the bar staff were still friendly, and I appreciate that. We ordered a few apps, some from the happy hour menu, some from the regular menu.
