I will say the tempura shrimp skewers are one of my favorite menu items. As well as the tacos.  I always have to remind myself that the spotted donkey is there for me.. a nice consistent tasty place....

First time here.  Dropped in on a weekend night about 6:15 pm... first open table not until 8:15, so we ate at the bar. Great lively vibe, nice people,great waitstaff and bartenders.  Best dish we had was the shrimp ceviche... robust flavors, with lots of crisp veggies and gorgeous shrimp.  Will be back for this alone.  Worst thing, unfortunately, was the guacamole appetizer!  Didn't taste house made or fresh.  We're returtning this weekend with friends... will definitely order the shrimp but probably not the guac.

This place is the BOMB!  Although we live a 1-1/2 hr drive away, whenever we head to Phoenix are for anything, we make sure to time it so that we can hit the Spotted Donkey in Scottsdale for either lunch or happy hour.  The frozen margaritas are to die for - they use something like a slushy machine to blend them and it keeps them slushy with no separation of ice & cocktail for the entire drink.  They are the best I've had anywhere! The tempura shrimp appetizers are the largest shrimp I've ever seen and the presentation is amazing.  The jalapeno shooters are a must have each & every time we go there and the calamari appetizer is like calamari steak strips with none of the stringy tentacle stuff attached - so delicious as well.  Everything we've seen being served as elicited comments from us such as "oooh that looks good" or "we should have ordered that too".  If you are lucky enough to go when Scott the bartender is working, you are in for a treat - he is a native Arizonian and a fountain of interesting, little known, knowledge regarding all things "Arizonian".  Personality plus as well and always has a genuine smile & a great sense of humor too.  Do yourself a favor and get there - if we can make it and have a 3 hour round trip each time, anyone within a 50 mile radius of Phoenix needs to experience this place.

$7.50 for the chips and super runny salsa- not a fan! Our waiter was nice and helpful when the kitchen messed up our order. Not excited about the food at all- maybe we both ordered the wrong thing? Chili Relleno and a chimichanga- but the ambiance was nice and the staff was pleasant. Maybe our leftover food we didn't want to eat there will be good in a tortilla tomorrow. Next time we want nice staff, pleasant atmosphere and we don't want to eat... we might be back. But probably not.

Found this place on Yelp and made a reservation for our weekend in the area attending spring training games. The drive was a little longer than we anticipated and it seemed as if we going out to the middle of nowhere... but then we made it to the el Pedregal center, and found the restaurant. This is a pretty business center in the foothills near The Boulders. While the center was not busy for a weekend night, The Spotted Donkey Cantina was abuzz.  We were a few minutes early for our reserved time, but they promptly seated us at a great corner table on the patio. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and seemed committed to making our experience a good one. As the sun set and the temp grew cooler, our request for the heater to be lit was promptly fulfilled. It kept us cozy while we enjoyed the lovely desert evening.  Our server made a few recommendations. It is the first time we've eaten at a Mexican restaurant where chips and salsa are not included in the dining experience, but we ordered them as an appetizer and they did not disappoint. Fresh, crispy chips were accompanied by a trio of delightful salsas. The dark, roasted tomato salsa was especially yummy and had a surprising after burn.  I ordered an unusual entree (for a Mexican food restaurant) that was spicy meatloaf with mashed potatoes and grilled asparagus. This was one of the server's recommendations and it was a good one. I really enjoyed the spicy jalapeño flavor of the meatloaf. My hubby ordered more traditional fare of chicken enchiladas. One enchilada had red sauce, the other one had green sauce. He was very happy with his selection and ate every bite.  This place is not cheap, and it is a bit more than "casual" but it made for a lovely date night that was truly enjoyable in every respect.

Had dinner last night. Food is great!  The Donkey nacho was awesome. Lots of flavor and the meat is tender with lots of fat. And fat is good!  Son ordered quesadilla with pork appetizer. The size is huge. I had pork tenderloin with pasta. So yummy and tender the pork I ate the entire thing.  Going back in 2 days.
Best nachos I've ever had in my life and that is saying a lot since I eat nachos at least once a week.

Better than average Mexican food for Arizona. Lovely restaurant - appropriate decorations; very good service.  Back for dinner with friends. Noisy, busy cantina - but the beer is cold and the food is good  I had an excellent Steak; M had a equally pork dish. Lots of food for less than $20 a plate. Good deal fun place

We walked over from the Boulders Resort at the end of happy hour - which is 3-6. They have good mojitos here! They didn't have a lot of vegetarian options on the menu but they gladly made me something off menu- bean & rice burro. My husband had a burger & he said it was excellent.   The biggest wow was the flan. Not all flan is good & it's easy to screw up, but theirs was excellent!   The reason i dropped a star is because it was overpriced & the food came out piecemeal.   If i am in the area i will be back for happy hour!

This place has become our go to place to eat. Don't get me wrong it's not amazing - but it is tasty, consistent and convenient to us. We've eaten here 3x  - I had green chile chicken enchiladas each time and my husband had the chimichanga (2x) and a quesadilla. The green chile pretty much lacked any heat but the enchiladas had a good flavor. My husband enjoyed what he tried although he agreed the chile had no heat. The price is pretty comparable with other places in this area. Staff is always friendly and helpful (we typically do a to-go order so I can't speak to the dining in experience). This, perhaps, some of the better Mexican food in the area.
vacationed at the boulders resort,restaurant is right next door,our family ate there 5 times, every meal was excellent ! Margaritas are the best I ever had, wish I lived closer !

I travel this country and once again yelp and a little help from my Hyatt girl this place was outstanding! From the start from the greeting to the chips and salsa they had me. Appetizers we went Queso and taquitos and both where fantastic. We shared a meal after a few margaritas (go prickley pair) Roja & Green Street enchiladas! I can say maybe the best Mexican dish I've had and I was supposed to be in Cabo this week.

This is my go to place for Happy Hour! The nachos are the best I've ever had. The tacos are great too. The bartenders and staff are very attentive and friendly. The restaurant is nothing fancy, it's just a fun, hang-out, take a break for the day type of place.

Went there after realizing that Brugo's was not open as advertised. I liked, just liked the food,but the service is terrible! We were a party do 4 that went in for dinner at about 415. There were only about 5 people in the place so when we entered we were quickly greeted and sat down and were the only party at the dining area.  Water was poured quickly and we were told our server would be with us soon. So after at least 10 minutes and not seeing anyone but the hostesses, bus staff and bartender,who all were engrossed in television at the bar, I went to FIND A SERVER. She arrived and seemed a bit perturbed and argumentative but took our orders. The food arrived quickly and was just ok, but very overpriced for the servings. Probably won't be going back here, there are too many great restaurants in the area with great service.

Eaten here for both lunch and dinner. Food choices range beyond the standard Mexican fare but are blander than I would expect. Margaritas average. If going for dinner in February or March call for a reservation.

So disappointing. We spent a night at The Boulders and while Mexican cuisine is not usually our go-to, we were really excited to dine at Spotted Donkey. I knew Cliff way back in the days when SD first opened, along with Luc's, and after many (many!) years of not being in the North Scottsdale area, was looking forward to the quality of food I had received years ago. I am not sure who owns it now, but the quality is def not the same.   To start, we ordered drinks (almost 10 minutes later finally got them...). I love spicy margaritas, so I ordered the Dulce Calor margarita...habanero infused tequila, cointreau and a housemade margarita mix (minus the sugared rim). It was terrible. There was no margarita flavor at all, it was almost like just chewing on piece of the habanero. I took maybe 2-3 sips, and not once throughout dinner - or even after as it sat there full, did our server ask if it was OK. (I also did not send it back, which I should have...so that is on me I suppose).   The shrimp ceviche is NOT a ceviche. It was full sized shrimp, thrown in a cup with some tomato sauce and few pieces of chopped zucchini and jicama - literally.   The main courses were OK. My husband ordered the Hatch Chili Pork Stew and said it was great. I didn't try it and he is pretty fussy, so if he says it was good, it was good. I ordered the LaGrande Chimichanga and that was also decent. It was good sized, and the crema on top was a nice touch. I am not used to the beans being in the actual chimi, but it was a different take and worked. We ordered a cheese quesadilla for our son, and it was a good size plate and would easily fill up a child of any age.   Dessert, again, disappointed. I was really hoping for a churro, but when they didn't have them, I was easily swayed to have the fried ice cream and we also ordered the 11-layer chocolate cake. The cake was eh, OK. Nothing special. I was expecting some rich flavor coming from the Patrol XO cafe, but you couldn't taste it at all. The ice cream - a disaster on a plate. There was so much whipped cream, I had to scrape it off to even attempt to find the actual fried ice cream and even that didn't have the nice crust that I am accustomed to when getting fried ice cream at other Mexican restaurants.   During the meal, I think our waiter checked on us once. My husband's water glass sat empty until I flagged down someone to ask them to refill it and we had to do the same for another beer for him.   The kicker to the entire experience was the lovely bus boy who came to the table next to us exclaiming to his partner bus boy, "let's get this shit done..." and I didn't catch the last part because I was too busy giving him a "are you serious look" as my 4 year old son is looking at me confused, knowing it's a "bad word". Seriously?!! What kind of training do you have?!   Food, mediocre at best.  Service, terrible.   As locals, I had such high hopes, as we need a go-to Mexican restaurant, and this is def not it!!

Good atmosphere and food considering they didn't include shrimp in a steak and shrimp burrito and added Sausage and Steak.   About 4 other people in the whole place so wasn't busy.  When I let the waiter know hat he talked to the chef and said it was a mistake.  I said no worries and ate it with my wife.  I thought because of the mistake they would take at least 10-20% off the bill.  NOPE.  No discount at all.  So I am giving them 2 stars for bad customer service.  In the Restaurant biz it's always first impression.    The responses I have seen from management on other posts on here  are pretty generic.  I'd say for management to talk to the cooks. 4 people in the entire restaurant and you screw up a Shrimp/Filet burrito?    Sorry.
The service can take a while and some things on the menu are iffy, but over all good. Their bean dip that you get is amazing. Drinks are a little weak, beside that is a great spot to check out.

Spotted Donkey is one of my favorite restaurants in Cave Creek!  I miss Robert and Cliff but the food is the same as when they were there, and it's great!  Scott is still there at the bar with the great service he has always given!  Always busy but worth it!  Love the tacos, the nachos, the chopped salad, and the enchiladas and the green chili soup, well I guess, everything!

The Spotted Donkey is always good food, creative selections with a nice atmosphere and attentive service - Last night's visit was no different and the New Mexican green chilli meatloaf was a very pleasant surprise - I almost always get the Jalapeno shooters as well as the guacamole and am never disappointed. They weren't too keen on handing us the restaurant week menu which I never understand - Its a promotion of the food and brings new and regular customers to the business - take the hit, offer it to me and I will likely be back. At Flemings if you request tthe restaurant week menu, you will likely be ignored for the rest of the evening. Not so here, so I got over it. A couple of tasty margarita's helped..

Came here on memorial day and place had a few customers.   Service was slow.  They charge for chips and salsa and ther meat is boiled.   Tacos were basically a flat wet corn tortilla with boiled bland meat.   Salsa was sweet and non traditional at all.   Really wanted this to be good as we are looking for a local spot but will not waste time and money again.   Pricey too

Wow - this place is amazing!  We stopped in one afternoon for a snack and a glass of wine.  We snagged a great seat on the patio and enjoyed the corn tamales and the chicken taquitos...this food is legit and I can't wait to come back for a full meal and enjoy all the menu has to offer.

So disappointing! My wife and I stopped in for lunch this afternoon. She had the enchilada plate and I tried the chili stew. Both were totally flavorless. The chili stew was supposed to have Hatch green chilis as an ingredient, but after careful searching through the bowl, it contained NONE. You could have figured that by the (lack of) flavor, but I just wanted to be sure. Plus the layer of grease on top...ughh. Scott, our waiter/bartender, however, was great. He turned an otherwise bad experience into something nice. Thanks, Scott!

The restaurant is good, very friendly and the prices are reasonable. I sat on the outdoor patio and was put off by the lighting. There were small useless lights on each table and one "parking lot" bulb lighting the entire patio. With some subtle lighting this place would be great but I felt like I was in a parking lot - you could not turn towards the one light without getting a painful beam of light in your eyes.

On our way out of the Scottsdale area and back to the airport to leave AZ (goodbye sun and warmth) we stopped at the Spotted Donkey Cantina as my friend and her family told us it was (and is) one of their favorite spots.  It would be our second day in a row eating Mexican food, but I wasn't upset about that.  I know there is good Mexican in AZ and soaking up as much of that as possible was never going to be a bad thing.  We started our meal out with the Donkey Nachos (short is $9.95, Regular is $14.95).  Our server suggested the short.  We are happy he did as this dish was still quite large.  These are not your typical nachos.  They definitely are doing something different with this dish.  La casa fried corn tortilla rounds, pulled pork, serrano chile roasted tomatoes, tomatillo salsa, cheddar and monterey jack cheeses queso fresco, black beans and mexican créma.  That is a mouthful and this dish was a mouthful.  Ended up doing some more sharing for this meal too.  That is fine by me as I can certainly eat my fair share and always nice to cut back on the portions.  For our main we had the Pollo en Mole Poblano ($15.95).  Oven roasted chicken breast, roasted plantains, chef Esteban signature mole sauce spanish rice with corn or flour tortillas.  Another very reasonable portion.  The chicken was a bit on the dry side, but the mole was very good.  It certainly helped as the dish was not lacking in mole at all.  It needed it.  All and all a nice place to occupy yourself for a couple of hours.  We were able to sit on the patio.  During this time of year it is just silly to sit inside when the weather is just about perfect here.

Found this place on OpenTable and Yelp looking for a fun Mexican restaurant in Scottsdale that's not too trendy or too expensive.  Really happy we chose Spotted Donkey. The atmosphere was festive but not too loud. They had the NFC Championship game on and we were interested in the two West Coast teams so could see the TVs in the bar from our table.  We ordered the $15 margaritas with their house tequila. It was delicious and smooth. The margarita was a little small but for a nice restaurant near a high-end resort, we expected that price tag.  Chips and salsa are not complimentary and the waiter tells you that early. Too bad so we ordered them at $7. They refilled the chips because there was a lot of salsa. They included a chorizo salsa and avocado salsa.  I ordered two enchiladas with rice and beans. Everything looked and tasted delicious. My wife had the vegetarian fajitas and liked them. We shared food with our toddler. My parents had the cobb and house salads.  What was fun in having a child in the restaurant is there are a lot of goofy framed photos on the wall of donkeys (appropriate). And there are a few animals on the tile floors in places so we could check all those out after the meal. It was like a mini scavenger hunt that was perfect for our daughter. And I was careful not to irritate other diners.  There were a few middle aged people throwing back drinks in the bar/restaurant area but they didn't get too rowdy. This place could get a bit wild perhaps if people are enjoying the alcohol a bit too much and only have to stumble back to their resort rooms.   There's also an outdoor patio with heaters.  Really hope to go back to the Spotted Donkey.
Marvelous!  Mexican but something more Travis was our waiter again. Everything special. We will come back again

This place was ok. The chips and salsa were good but the guacamole tasted store bought. Had the chicken fajitas which had a great smokey flavor but not enough chicken in them. I also really liked the pork Mac and cheese which was a great recommendation by the waiter. Pretty good Mexican place.
Fantastic. Servings were generous. The Flourless chocolate cake was awesome. Lots of gluten free items too!

I've been here a few times and always had great food. On the latest trip, I tried the duck quesadilla. It's the only time I've seen duck used in a quesadilla, but the meat was plentiful and had an excellent flavor. The tortilla and cheese were cooked well. It also came with a blood orage habanero dipping sauce, which was incredible. The fruit flavors made it almost like candy, but then the habanero packed a huge punch of spice. I definitely recommend this dish.   Another tasty item is the chips and guacamole appetizer. I don't typically like guacamole, but they do a great job here and mix in a lot of fresh ingredients. You can ask for salsa on the side as well.  The staff are friendly and courteous. The menu items are priced fairly. Although it is located way out in the middle of nowhere, this is a place worth trying for a nice Mexican-inspired meal.

No no no no!!!! The only thing this place has going for it is the outside patio seating. That's it.   It's just plain and simple lousy lousy Mexican food. I've had several dishes here and my husband and I decided tonight this was off of our list permanently. Tonight we had the fish tacos and it was a lot of cabbage with three bites of fish for close to $16. You're better off going to Rubio's.   There are way too many really good Mexican restaurants in Scottsdale and this one is simply not worth it.
Just the best mexican food i have ever eaten. Not exactly inexpensive, but sometimes you get what you pay for. I will definitely be back!
This is probably the worst "Mexican food" in AZ. The food is horrible and the service isn't much to praise either. We will not be returning.
One complaint, ordered the filet mignon steak fajitas, to my surprise they mix a few pieces of steak and lots of chorizo sausage in this dish.  NO MENTION OF THE SAUSAGE ON THE MRNU.  ITS A SCAM.

Our server Melissa was Awesome. We were here for happy hour WOW great ! The Nachos were the best we ever had, California included. Restaurant is tucked away and a bit hard to find, but well worth it ! Authentic Mexican food - delicious !

Jalepeno shots are great! A lil spicy for you novices, but nothing scorching for those who like the heat. The carne asada was great and salmon tostada was mmmtastic. Service what what you'd hope for in all restaurants, friendly faces, timely and proactive.
Don't have anything bad to say!   Good food and good drinks!   The shooter appetizer was awesome!

Felt like they were doing us a favor!!  Bartender needs a major attitude adjustment!  Party of 6--no place to sit in the small bar area for Happy Hour, so after we sat down to the only table that could accommodate us right next to the bar. Felt like they'd rather us dine somewhere else! Food and drinks were nothing special. They have a great location. Sadly they just don't realize they need us more than we need them!!!    I also had a Fake Profile "compliment me". Sounds like an employee!! It's going to be a full time job commenting on all the negative reviews.

Been here a few times - meals have always been great - love their happy hour.  Great patio to sit outside when the weather is nice and enjoy the view.  Service is always fantastic.    However... I have to mention my fajitas the other night... O M G ... I don't consider myself an expert on proper fajitas ... I just know when they're done wrong - they're really wrong.  These were incredibly delicious!  I shared a SMALL taste with my dining companion.... he agreed that they were awesome!  I don't know what they did .. but I do promise - I'll be back again and again and again.  Headed over tonight to a 4 course meal and tasting hosted by Herradura Tequila... I can't wait!

Seafood enchiladas in North Scottsdale? Say yes and don't look back! The Enchilada de Mariscos here is comprised of seared shrimp, blue crab, cheddar and monterey jack cheeses, rice and orange pico. And, it's 100% delicious. Be sure to order the guacamole appetizer too. The chips are addicting. Maybe the reason why the location is so far from town is so that you have time to digest on the car ride home. With the 2014 Opentable Diner's Choice award, you can't go wrong.

No no no no. This is a busy restaurant affiliated with the Boulders hotel. It's a corporate version of a Mexican/Spanish hotel. I had a salad with roasted pumpkin seeds that was good - the rest of it, fajitas, fish tacos or enchiladas were huge portions but heavy & dull. No tamales at all.  The bar was lively & popular.
Great food, worth the drive.

We ate here twice while staying at The Boulders Resort. Margaritas we're strong and the food was delicious! My favorite was the queso and the barbacoa tacos. Lisa and Jill were our severs and were top notch. Highly recommended !

This is one of my favorite stops in Carefree.  The service is always great and the appetizers are delicious. We can have a meal by sharing just  the nachos. This is the only restaurant where I enjoy a blended margarita and they offer different flavors.

This place was absolutely grotesque! Everyone left their meals and NO THANKS to the to go boxes! No one seemed to care at all about the experience. $120 out the window for something worse than dog food! N-A-S-T-Y!!!  way less than 1 star!! Poor service too!!

Spotted Donkey Cantina is one of two businesses in the mostly deserted Pedregal. This is a South West Mexican Style Restaurant. I ordered the Mexico City Carne Asada. They gave me a very large portion of chewy steak. It was suppose to be marinated with arbor chile that might have been delicious but I didn't detect that. It was chewy and not tasty. My stomach turned when I tasted the peppers and onions because they were sour tasting. I think the sour peppers and onions spread to the steak and I couldn't eat it. I asked my husband to taste the peppers and onions and he said they tasted funky. I also noticed the picco on my plate looked very old. (blow up picture this is visible) Off to the side of my plate was something that resembled pond scum....I was brave and tasted it. The green slime on my plate was oddly sweet with honey and lime and not tasty....it wasn't flavored right or maybe it was just old sauce. My tortillas were fresh tasting and the potato cakes were fried nicely and seemed free of oil with a nice crispy exterior but lacked the chile they were suppose to contain.  My husband tried the Poblano Chile Relleno. He said it was a Poblano Pepper stuffed with mushy pork and greasy mushy rice topped with a strange tasting tomato sauce. He said his meal wasn't as bad as mine.  Our waitress seemed nice and asked me if I wanted mine boxed up but I declined.  I didn't feel that I could complain about the food here because I was getting one meal free because of my Scottsdale Preferred Card.

On the Boulders property, this second floor bistro served my wife and I delicious margaritas and had a passable, affordable wine list.  To start, the jumbo shrimp were delicious and the poppers a jalapeño-lover's delight!. The salad was fresh and easily split, as it was huge. The fajitas were terrific and the Puerco on Mac and cheese was scrumptious!  Good service too.   Perhaps importantly we were there on New Years Eve and called for reservations but no tables were available.  We tried thru the concierge, still nothing. Thru Open Table, however, we got a reservation at he exact time we had requested previously thru the resort!?  When we were seated we were shocked to see about half the tables empty.  Guess the message is don't take no for an answer or use Open Table.  It's a good place for dinner.

I recommended this place to my daughter and her friends when they were in visiting us from Chicago.  I am sorry i did.   4 young working professionals (age 27-38)  walked into the Spotted Donkey.  They waited for someone to acknowledge them and 10 minutes passed and no one did.   The place had only 2 table occupied with elderly couples.   Finally a woman seated us and then took many minutes to return ...we ordered the nachos, which were horrible.  Tasteless, she returned and we asked for the check...she was so rude to the young ladies thatthey and we will never return there.  We certainly will not recommend to any of our visiting friends.

This place looks like your typical southwestern café on the top level of a upscale strip mall on the edge of the 5 star Boulders resort property. So I wasn't really sure if it would be trying to be more fancy or mainstream. Its closer to the latter.  The decor is exactly what you expect to see in thousands of southwest cafés around Phoenix.   However, the music is an interesting choice for a southwestern café... 70's rock!?!?  While I was there I listened to numerous songs by Supertramp, ELO, Fleetwood Mac, etc. Great songs, but it didn't really set the atmosphere of the Sonoran desert decorations.   Super nice people though. I sat at the bar and ordered food. Even though it was only 35 minutes before closing time, they were overly welcoming and nice. Outstanding service, and pretty quick too.   I had the carnitas chinichanga which was great. Super moist and flavorful. But you can't really pick it up with your hands because its covered in sauce and falls apart since it was already cut in half for me. So you need to eat it with a knife and fork, but the flavors were all there.  Considering this is inside a 5 star resort's property, the prices are also fairly reasonable. My chimichanga and iced tea were $20 including tax.
I can't figure out why this restaurant doesn't get better reviews! Our experience here was really great. The food was excellent, the service was perfect! We will be back again!!

Disappointed and would not refer anyone to go there. Food was ok, service was slow, and the margaritas were lousy.   The "Online" Menu items for this restaurant are not served here; they have a different menu.   Worst customer service. If a customer is frustrated or has a question, usually a manager finds out why and helps be a solution. Not here. The Manager sides with servers (at least our female server) without listening to customer to see the whole picture and context of the customers questions about a bill or situation. Servers here are too sensitive & get offended over what a normal bar server wouldn't be, and they seem to lack common sense.   Not being informed of an automatic charge of 20% gratuity at the time of the reservation or upon ordering, is not acceptable. Discovering this information is quite shocking, especially when server doesn't deserve a 20% tip for poor service & you feel it should be lowered.    I enjoy a good meal, but it's not worth the servers attitude, or walking on eggshells with your words out of fear for what mood the server is in, and then a rude manager assuming whatever their server told them is automatically the only truth to a situation.   So bottom line, we questioned a 20% mandatory tip and expressed opinion about not knowing and due to lack of service how to adjust it. Next we know, the manager is at our table scolding us that his server got her feelings hurt and we are no longer welcome there. Hmmm... Feelings hurt? I bet. She wants her 20% tip and knew we weren't happy with her service. Well... Hope you don't step on an eggshell while you are there...if you try the place out.  My group of 6 won't be back.  On top of it...they charged my client's bill on my guest's credit card. I had to call the restaurant to fix it. Luckily they did that at least.

We were staying at the resort and decided to have dinner at the Spotted Donkey. Kelley was our waitress and she was absolutely fantastic! She recommended the nachos and they were a hit. Probably the best nachos both my husband and I have had. We were also looking for her recommendation for our entree and instead of telling us what she recommends, she decided to just surprise us. We had such a great experience and left satisfied. Thanks Kelley for being so awesome!

Terrible service, lousy food and gouging prices. I will NEVER COME BACK! Who the hell charges $8.00 for chips and salsa? Then keeps refilling it for $8 a pop? We were NEVER told of the charge! 20% automatic service charge for slow service that never even refilled my water in two hours. Save your money and STAY AWAY! They should be ashamed. There are plenty of good Mexican food restaurants in Scottsdale this one is awful!

It's expensive BUT it's worth it for a special night. Fantastic menu.. Amazing mixology drinks and an impressive tequila list to chose from. Beautiful scenery and not overly packed Bc it's kinda out there a bit. If you get a chance, check out Boulders too.

Expensive and not that great. Not gonna lie, I hate Mexican restaurants that don't give you chips! Anyway, it's expensive & the food is fine. The hostess was nice enough, more into the game on the tv than us, we have a kid and she did give us a high chair and a kids water but not a kids menu. Our waiter was nice.
Good atmosphere and food.  I was disappointed that the food was very americanized the food was sweet not spicey at all.

Very nice atmosphere. Not sure I'm ok with paying $7.50 for chips and salsa, but it is the boulders.  We had the donkey nachos and the portion was huge. It was really really good. Service at the bar was great as well.
Great margaritas.  I had the donkey special margarita and it was excellent.  The food is large portion and good quality. Ambience is very ! Yes

Food was nothing special. Guacamole was barely visible on my plate and gross and runny. Rojo sauce on enchiladas was good. Server never checked in on our meal. Asked for chips and salsa because saw them on all the other tables, surprised to get the check and see $7.50 charge for chips?! Are you kidding? Taquerias give you free chips with your $5.00 burrito. Mexican food for old white people I guess. Will not be returning..ever!
Very good food while being a bit pricey. Great ambiance and cool location. Good upscale dining experience. Forecast for dates but not the routine place to dine.

A friend recommended this place so I gave it a try.  It was a bit crazy from some kind of convention group or something.  The service was really sub par.  From delays to misunderstandings, it wasn't a good impression.  The food was tasty and the view was nice.  Maybe worth another try at a less busy time.
My family and I have been coming to spotted donkey for years now and it never disappoints! Great food and friendly staff!
All four of us were disappointed in our dinner last night on both the food and beverage front.  This place has sadly gone down hill on each visit since we came for the first time.

Call it three and a half.  I think I'm spoiled having Frotera Grill and Topolobampo here in Chicago.  Spotted Donkey was good, just nothing spectacular.  Their guacamole was good and the ceviche was tasty.  My wife had the shrimp tacos, which she seemed to like.  I had the carne asada, which was a bit overcooked and tough from the bad cut.  The sides were typical staples like mexican rice and beans.  There was not much creativity from the menu choices and again it seemed like typical mexican fare.  They also had some really funny pics of donkeys around the place.

Just had lunch.  Food was awful.  Although presented as "very hot" the 2 enchiladas were cool, as were the beans.  The enchiladas shells were rubber (very difficult to cut and chew) and what used to be white breast meet chicken (we used to have lunch every week at this restaurant, however we stopped when service and quality of food dropped...just wanted to give one more chance because we like the decor) is now dark brown (obviously lower grade chicken).  Sadly, we will not be back.  Way too many better options.

Great atmosphere, food, and service! Our server was very friendly and knowledgeable about the different tequilas they have. The atmosphere is good for a romantic date or for a family meal. I would definitely eat here again!

Here we go again with ridiculously priced guacamole, but it was so good I forgot about the price.  And the jalapeno shooters?  Genius.  I only wish we had ordered a "double barrel" and not a "six shooter."  We only had appetizers on my one visit to Spotted Donkey, but it was enough that I wouldn't mind the drive up to Carefree a second time with the obligatory stay at The Boulders...just in case we shouldn't drive home.

After a long hike in Seven Springs cave creek area, we decided to try this place. It's been just about a month since we've been here but definitely worth the review.  The Baja shrimp tacos were fresh and tasty! It only came with 2 tacos for $15 but they were large tacos that were filling especially with its included side of rice. My friend had the same entreé but had one of the tacos with beer battered mahi instead of both shrimp, which he reports was very enjoyable.  My hubs had the beef barbacoa grande chimichanga and it was flavorful! The outside was crisply fried, which is tough since chimis can get soggy quickly. It creatively was served in halved with one of the halves standing vertically like a "pillar of yumminess."  Unfortunately, chips and salsa are not free. If you order this though, you may want extra of the guacamole tomatillo salsa out of the three served.   As far as cocktails go, the Dulce Calor delivered exactly what its name implies. It's a drink with spiciness but enough sweet to get you through it. Perfect inner warmth on a cool breezy Sunday morning. I wanted a Bloody Mary too but they didn't have any of the ingredients for it that morning so I settled for an apple pie sangria which was written on their chalkboard menu coming in. I'm not sure if it tasted quite like apple pie but it was sweet like a dessert.   The ambiance is zany and lovely with very quirky but cute large photos of donkeys covering the walls, Saltillo tile floors, and large wood furniture and booths. I really liked the inside and would love to check out the patio when it's a bit warmer outside. Service was a slower at the end but it doesn't stop me from wanting to go back at some point.

This is a terrific restaurant.  Good food and atmosphere.  Service is also good....especially Dan.  My only criticism is that the staff is not always clear on what items are vegetarian.  I've dined there on several occasions with vegetarians and the wait staff doesn't always know if items like rice or sauces are made with chicken stock.  Fortunately the manager is vegetarian and was very kind when rice, made with chicken stock, was served to a vegetarian diner.  Otherwise, I highly recommend Spotted Donkey!

Every aspect of our meal was impeccable from the drink presentations to the fried bananas at the end of our meal.   The servers are knowledgeable and it was the best Mexican/Southwestern food that I have had in the valley.  Located in El Pedregal enhances the evening with the beautiful Coy ponds and manicured grounds. It was an outstanding dining experience...  #vino2ultimate #vinosquared
Make sure you get Kate for your server if you are looking for an education about tequila. Excellent food, excellent service. Top of the list for us in Cave Creek.

Tortilla crusted, hand stuffed cheddar and bacon filled jalapeno shots dipped in a cilantro buttermilk sauce. Enough said. Picture this. Fried jalapenos sitting in a shot glass of buttermilk sauce. You take it out of the shot glass and bite into a fried jalapeno of gooey cheese that's oozing out. Along with the cheese, you taste bacon and southwest flavor. It's so good, you must have another and another and another...until all six have disappeared and you wish you had six more. This was my most recent experience at Spotted Donkey. They are called "Shooters" and you can order six or 12. After tasting them, I highly suggest going with the order of 12, that is, if you're hungry for fried happiness!   This still stands as one of my most favorite restaurants in the Carefree area. I've been visiting since I was a teenager and it still has yet to disappoint. Everything here is delicious, especially the southwestern mac and cheese and the stuffed chile peppers. Really, you can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

We really enjoy this place. It's located upstairs in the El Pedregal complex, south of The Boulders. It is not your typical Mexican restaurant, but worth a try. Be prepared to pay for chips as they are not included. We selected the fajitas and the carne asada. Both were outstanding. Overall a fun place

I was staying at the Boulders Resort and wandered over here for dinner. The fish tacos were so yummy and piled high with cabbage, pico and creme. I was full after ordering the chips and salsa- they come with 3 flavors and they are all packing a variety of flavors. The Prickly Pear margarita rocked too! I sat on the rooftop patio with a heat lamp. I enjoyed it here and the food is really good. If I am ever back in Scottsdale this will be a stop I make.

We have tried Spotted Donkey twice in the last 4 months.  Each time there has been an incremental decrease in the quality of the food and SERVICE.  We will try again but our most recent Happy Hour visit left us scratching our heads.  We love our local establishments and I encourage everyone to give them a try...come to your own conclusion.  A very very cool venue and i hope that the precipitous decline in service is short lived.

Cold chips n salsa. Not ideal for $7.50 when the beef and bean salsa is also served cold and none of the 3 are up to spicy standard. The seating is also odd, they try to sit you close to other tables when clearly there are empty private tables. We made friends with our neighbors and good calamari. Just came for drinks and apps-and hey my boyfriend reminded me to not be a donkey so 4 stars here.
Love it!  Drinks could use a little updating. Food is delicious!  Environment is casual and clean. Staff are very friendly. Chips and 3 kinds if salsa- best I've had in a long time! Muchas Gracias!

Of the high end Mexican restaurants, this is my favorite.  It's not an inexpensive restaurant but the quality of the cheese, meats and veg is certainly a cut above.  The atmosphere is more upscale than a typical Mexican restaurant and the barkeep does a mean margarita.  Additionally, I love their chips and salsa.  They have an excellent salsa with light portions of meat in it which is delicious.  I'm a fan.

I was in grandma's neck of the cactus patch and was pleased to see some new ownership and style take up in the old Mexican restaurant we used to haunt.  The Spotted Donkey represents a HUGE improvement over the previous joint, in decor (saucy industrial chic), menu (crazy creative), and execution.  Everything was delicious and well presented, if a little over the top and Texas-style in proportion.  I took 2/3 of my entree home and we never did finish those chips.  Speaking of which...  $7 for chips and salsa??  Is this a social experiment???  Am I being tape-recorded for reaction?  Am I at the Giant's stadium?  Is there some unspoken guarantee that in eating these chips I will experience spontaneous orgasm daily over the next week?  Please someone explain before I take the rest of the stars away, too.

OH MY GOSH!  I had no hope or expectation that this would be any better than average at best.  Holy Moley!  The Spotted Donkey Delivers!  This place is in a nice area, yet still out there enough to feel like a destination.  It is very well decorated and service is phenomenal.  The food is out of this world too!  Here is a prime example of a place that charges a little more than normal for Mexican food but does a stellar job of making sure you get the value that they are charging you for.

Busy, busy spot. We stopped in on a Friday night for a quick snack.  Al of the outside seating was full and there was a short wait for tables.  We did find a spot in the bar area.  We had margaritas and the prawns appetizer!  Both were great!!   Our server was very attentive and friendly.  Good vibes all around us....we will be back!  Lots of TV's in the bar area.  Nice place to go to watch the sunset.
Great food, nice ambience and service.  My only note would be that they bring food so fast it makes you feel rushed.
Delicious food and margaritas! We had enchiladas and a burrito, very filling, the beans were great. This was a fun place with great decor. Shuttle from The Boulders took us straight there.

Yet again, Phoenicians, I worry about your taste buds. Have they ever actually had amazing high-end Mexican?  The Spotted Donkey is a solid option for well-executed, if a bit odd, Mexican with a twist. For the price, I expected a table-side preparation of a giant guacamole bowl. It was fresh, and if it's you're bag, impressively smooth. The flavors meld well, but it's not spicy or particularly unique. The shrimp cocktail, done in a 'ceviche' style was certainly different. The 'ceviche' term is misappropriated - it's not ceviche, but closer to a 'campechana.' The addition of cucumber to the traditional mix of avocado, onion, tomato, cilantro, lime, and hot sauce was unique - not in a bad way, just an unexpected, unconventional note among a typical preparation.

OK this was fun.    We just arrive at the Bolders after a six hour drive.    Dropped off the luggage and found this little gem for lunch.   The Cadillac margaritas were refreshing with a generous pour of tequila.   We shared and enjoyed the shrimp cevice and the nacho's.   Oh but not just nacho's!   You are properly warned in advance that they are not what one would typically expect.    Corn toritillas and cheese yes.    But add to it olives, black beans and red and green enchilada sauce.   An amazing concoction of flavors!  The cevice was fresh, generous and full of flavor.     Our server was attentive and as friendly as can be.    We wish we could box this place up and take it home to California!

My wife's favorite place to eat and I also enjoy the place. Some of the best gourmet level Mexican food in the area. We've not found a better place for fish tacos. Service is excellent and a friendly atmosphere. Also, the prices are good, no gouging high prices.

The El Burro Pinto Tacos with 'Macacha' chicken are literally the blandest tacos I've had in my life.  I assumed 'Machaca' meant some sort of seasoned chicken with dynamic flavor. I was wrong. It was standard pulled chicken (available in any Mexican restaurant) with zero seasoning.  The tacos came with an extremely small amount of Pico (with no flavor), guac and sour cream (all tiny portion sizes). Are they attempting to nickel and dime you into buying more? (Considering chips and salsa are a pricey $7.50).  Got a side of salsa for the tacos, not very good.   Queso Fundido was average. If you appreciate good Queso, I don't think you'll be impressed. However, my fiancé says the Queso is good.  Not being overly critical, this place is close to where I stay in Scottsdale -- I would come back if I liked it.  But if you're wanting some top quality Mexican food, I suggest looking elsewhere.

Huge fan! The jalapeño shooters are hot hot hot and delicious! The fish tacos are also very good  I don't remember what everyone else at my table got but we all walked away satisfied. We also had an awesome waiter who was super friendly -- I'm not sure if that's a turn off to some people, but we had a blast!

My husband and I had dinner here the other night.  Very friendly servers and great margarita's.  I had the enchiladas (one chicken and one beef), probably the best I have had and I am a bit on the picky side when it comes to mexican food.   Highly recommend it. The only comment I would make is that as a non-local it was hard to find the place from the street.  Thank heavens for navigation but even with that we kept driving past it since from the street is seemed more like a business/office complex than a retail establishment.

Wow. Ate here while staying at the Boulders. Great food. Everything we ate was amazing. Food was on the spicy side which I enjoyed! House margarita was one of the best I've had,Very fresh! I highly recommend the pulled pork sandwich on the pretzel bun. We were here during off season do there was no wait.
It is the only place to eat mexican food in Cave Creek or Carefree.  Pulled pork Nachos with  Guacamole and Poppers are awesome!  They have great Fajitas as well!
Awesome guacamole and the tacos are great! We live in AZ and stopped in for dinner when staying at the boulders. I recommend it!

After hearing reviews, maybe expectations were too high.  Very average-below average.  Have to pay for chips and salsa is a downer, 5 in our party, used to high quality mexican food from Chicago Mexican restaurants, and most were disappointed, the mac and cheese was gross.  Cannot nail the easy things like burritos or tacos. Fillets de puerto was so average, nothing "especial".  Not trying to be a jerk, but we had better Mexican at the places in Cave Creek easily.  Nice location and patio, but the food is over-rated.

We went to the Spotted Donkey while staying at The Boulders. I had the enchiladas which were delicious and tried my girlfriend's chimichanga which was even better. But my favorite part of the meal were the donkey nachos. Loaded with delicious meat and so flavorful. If I lived in the area, I would be a regular.

Great place to eat, with items on the "Mexican" menu I've never experienced before, however was very tasty !   meat loaf w/Green Chilli was wonderful, as were the Shrimp and Crab tostadas. Yummy. Good service, friendly, dark atmosphere, however if it's around a busy holiday or weekend, call and make a reservation first.  Minimal wine menu, good beer though, and food was brought out fast.

I love this place. Have been there many times. The food is great, we like to sit at the bar. The bartenders are awesome and very attentive. It is in the middle of no where but that doesn't stop us from going there at least once a month!!!!
The food and drinks are on point; the servers and bartender were amazing! If you are staying at the resort it is such a pretty walk from the main building.

The Spotted Donkey is located either on or right next to The Boulders. Living here in north Scottsdale I had high expectations for this restaurant, with a yelp rating of 4 stars and over 100 reviews, how can we miss. We arrived after 8pm and the place was still quite crowded, so I am thinking we are off and running to the races! Not so fast!. The service was very good and ambience was fine, however the food was as bland and boring as a hospital cafeteria. I will not bore you with the details, just no real taste to anything we ate. So I asked for a desert menu and we ordered the sopapillas and ice cream. They coated everything with this awful tasting honey. and again the ice cream had no flavor to it. When I see 4 stars and over 100 reviews I begin to wonder about this social media review system Yelp has going on here.  But have no fear I am still a believer, most of the time when a restaurant has over 100 reviews you can really count on yelp
Service and food are good.  Sit on the patio for a nice dining experience.   Not true Mexican food yet still enjoyable.

I was told that we were going to eat at a "high-end" Mexican restaurant. I love Mexican food plus it has 4 stars on Yelp, so I was really excited to go there to eat dinner.  I gave them 2 stars because the service was good, although the waiter kept referring to us as "my people". Hmmmm? That was a first.  The menu doesn't offer many choices, and covers only one page, the other side is for alcohol. Ordered chips and salsa, which they offer as an appetizer, in other words it's not FREE like most Mexican restaurants. It should have been though because all three salsas were bland and tasteless. I ordered chicken tacos with rice and beans. Presentation was nice but it didn't make up for the crunchy rice or the watery beans. The shredded chicken on the taco's was ok but definitely not "high-end".  My husband ordered a chimichanga. He was also disappointed and commented that the meat was horrible and it was fried for too long.  Personally, I would never return to this restaurant. Maybe I misunderstood and they said it was "high priced", not high-end. Regardless, I do not recommend this establishment to anyone.

I drove from MN to make sure I tasted their signature Duncan Calor Margareta. It was worth the drive, however the Donkey Nachos were recommended and did not measure up to expectations. Way too much cheese and lacking on flavor.

My husband and I went on a Wednesday night. It wasn't busy but service seemed a little slow.  I had the Mexican Mule which is their take on the Moscow Mule.  It was tasty. Also had the trio of salsas, the queso fundido and the ceviche. The ceviche needed salt, but the salsas were good. Our favorite was the black bean one. The Queso was by far our favorite I would definitely get that again. Otherwise though nothing really stood out to us. This would not be my first choice of places for a return visit.

The jalapeño shooters are so good!! The buttermilk ranch the poppers are dipped in is perfect! Definitely recommend the shredded beef enchiladas! I always tell people about this place and how it never disappoints!! Worth the 30 min drive out from my house.

Very good experience. The server was a professional walking us briefly through the menu recognizing we were health conscious The coffee and water were always filled and the fajitas were brought table side sizzling. The beef was truly filet of beef. The guacamole was tremendous. Highly recommend the Spotted Donkey.

Worst service ever. And they tried to bribe me with a horrible chocolate cake.  I was staying at the Boulders, Waldorf Astoria with my family.  I heard this restaurant was great so i called to order take out. 20 minutes of calling no one answered.  I decided to go and order in person.  Once was there the host was great. Nice and polite.   My bigger issue was that they messed up the order and didn't include several items in my TO GO order.  Once I was back at the hotel, sat down with family, and was unwrapping dinner I noticed they forgot a few items.  Already 20 minutes away I had to get ready and head back to the restaurant where the host was nice enough to take quick action. Severa minutes later they came out and gave me my correct order.   My gripe is that on to go orders, restaurants need to be more exact.  I think forgetting "to go" items is the worst next to spitting in the food.  Also the food wasn't great. The hotel bar food was better. I should of just ordered room service.  It was that bad.   Dear spotted donkey: no need to bribe your customers... Just get it right the first time.  Have some quality control.
We had heard so much about this restaurant but we were very disappointed with the service and the food the first round of margaritas was sent back and the second round was no better.

*UPDATE* I believe that one of their employees made a fake profile to say rude and nasty things to me! They said "you sound like a giant douche bag. and have no life." I think this because it was sent to me by a brand new profile with no reviews or anything and its location is not even in Arizona. Anyone else have this happen?  (This is what I reviewed the first time with three stars) This place is okay. It was very slow and no one was in their when we went. We ordered the jalapeños dunked in ranch and they were cold in the middle. And we got asked by like there different employees if they were hot or mild. All we wanted was to eat lunch in peace not be asked a ton of questions. It took forever for our drinks to be filled and for someone to come get our payment.

We have eaten here about 6 times now!  It is really great!  We live in Canada, but own a house in Terravita so just across the road!  My favourite dishes:  Enchilladas (usually a chicken girl, but always order two beef, you get a choice)  Their classic Margarita is great!  My favourite appetizer now is the shrimp, it is around $15, but I can attest they are amazing!  The staff are great, sorry I don't remember all your names!  Lauren is one I do remember and she is super nice!   I love the outside seating!

I've been to Spotted Donkey many times and have always loved the delicious food and unique menu item choices. I was there today and as much as I enjoyed the meal I ordered, I was shocked and felt totally gouged by the $9 charge for the basket of chips brought to the table when we sat down. I don't think I've ever been to a Mexican restaurant where I was charged for the chips. Shame on the owners for that.
First time i have been here it was such an fabulous western restaurant, they were very kind and friendly, i love the food it was soo soo delicious I recommend this restaurant

This is hands down the best Mexican place in the area in terms of quality and service if you want upscale variations on classics! The cocktails are excellent and salads are delish! I recommend the salmon, which is truly original.

We visited two nights in a row on our recent trip to the Boulders Resort. The first night we sat on the outdoor patio and enjoyed margaritas with chips and salsa. The cactus heart cocktail is delicious, and the alcohol content is perfect- not too weak, not too boozy. Both nights I ordered the signature shrimp tacos because they were so yummy. The second night we also shared a bowl of the tortilla soup, delicious with greens and tortilla strips.  The decor inside is fun and festive, with pretty light fixtures and wall hangings. Service is friendly and timely.

If you're a fan of Barrio Cafe, you may be even a bigger fan of Spotted Donkey. Prices are not the friendliest, but the gourmet Mexican food will make your stomach sing Mexican mariachi music. I started with a prickly pear margarita - que buenisimo! Even though you have to pay for chips and salsa, the chips are delicioso and homemade and the 3 salsas that accompany are very tasty. Their "chop" salad was on par with Cowboy Ciao's similar version, and for an entree the pulled pork chalupas were divine. I'll be back soon for more!  UPDATE: As of January '08 the quality has really dived at Spotted Donkey. The owners opened up a new restaurant next door and I think their hearts and minds are there now. We gave them 3 shots before writing this update which brings them from 5 to 3 stars.

Some Friends drag me back to this place, I am kicking and screaming because my previous visits have all been bad. I remain baffled at the appeal of this place, where their over salted, flat tasting, premade sauced food is difficult to eat. The chips and salsa remain the staple here. But no one goes out for dinner just for chips and salsa, now do they? If the margaritas were good, we could make an argument that this would be a good place to hang out for drinks. Unfortunately, the margaritas are sickeningly sweet and weak to boot. Ordering side shots, and pouring those into the drinks helped, but turned already expensive drinks into monstrously expensive drinks. The bartenders here, without fail, exhibit no personality, but simply act as if they are working for a resort restaurant which this place is.  No one here seems happy, but simply want to be left a huge tip from the upscale clientele that frequent this place. I cannot think of a more disappointing place to bring guests, unless you sit outside on the patio, which is very nice, and your guests don't notice the bad food and the bad drinks.

Another great meal. This place has managed quite a feat staying consistent over the past 5 years we have been coming. The restaurant business isn't easy but the spotted donkey makes it look seamless. Excellent and authentic Mexican food and creative and inspired drinks make this a must visit destination when we are staying at the Boulders! Thank you to the staff for being so warm and accommodating.
3 stars because the quesadilla was not good.  But I dined again and the enchiladas were slammin! And I really enjoyed the Loaded Mule- a tequila spin on the Moscow Mule.
Great happy hour. Jalapeño poppers are great and have some serious heat. Good food and fun, casual atmosphere. Highly recommended.

We've eaten here many times and have always enjoyed our food and the service.  The wait staff has always been friendly but our favorite waitress is Jill.  We missed seeing her today but still enjoyed our Calamari appetizer and the fajitas.  (I had the shrimp fajitas and my boyfriend had the beef & sausage fajita, which I've never seen on any menu before.)  Both were delicious! They charge a tad more than other places but I'd rather pay a bit more than pay less for mediocre food.  My favorite dish is the Tierra y Mar Burro which is filet mignon, shrimp, avocado, jack cheese, black beans, french fries and chipotle aioli all wrapped inside the burrito. Yum!  We'll be back.

The spotted donkey!! Yes please! Such a fabulous southwestern restaurant with a mix of Arizona and Mexican food. Recommended by our hotel staff we ventured farther out on the resort property to sample some deliciousness at the donkey. Most Mexican restaurants are not my jam but this one offers more of an upscale feel while still keeping a family vibe to it. We ordered their top shelf margarita with tequila that is only carried here straight from Mexico. The drink was extremely smooth with a hint of smokiness, I'm typically a wine guy so one was enough to give me a quick buzz. For starters we shared the Donkey Nachos substituting the pulled pork for chicken and getting a side of guacamole. The nachos were too die for, the sauce, beans, housemade chips omg so amazing!!!! I could have ordered to more plates of the nachos and been content with the evening. For our dinner my wife ordered the mahi mahi fish tacos, huge portion which she only could finish half of. I had the shrimp fajitas with the sauce and spices this dish is highly recommend my only wish was for corn tortillas and not flour. Finally for dessert we had the fried ice cream and had I known how big it was we would have passed.  Another fantastic property restaurant that makes staying at the Boulders all the more magical.
Awesome staff.  Salad was excellent.  If you are staying at The Boulders it's a good option.

This place was recommended by a friend. This place might have been good at one point but despite good service, I cannot give it more than one star.  Is a little hard to find. It's on the second floor near. E pedregal resort. All other shops seem to have close in the mall. The elevator to get up there is quite dirty   We went for Sunday lunch. We were seated and staff is friendly and prompt. My wife ordered a Mojito which had mint which was not fresh and almost black.  She ordered the chicken tacos. The meat was tender but had no spice or seasoning at all. Same with my shrimp tacos. Shrimps seemed fresh but no seasoning. The guacamole which we ordered for appetizer is not made to order. They apparently make one batch per day.   Our waiter was friend but we will not be going to this place again. Friendly service was the only reason this place got two stars instead of one.

This place has so much potential.  Great atmosphere located in a somewhat quiet and secluded area of north Scottsdale without all the crowds.  Unfortunately, the three times that I have been here, the service has sucked.  The servers here lack personality and enthusiasm, and generally seem annoyed at serving you.  Throughout the meal, the service has been sparse with no one checking in to see if you need anything else with your meal.  If you need a fork or a refill, forget it, you will have to get up from your table and get it yourself.  The food has been good every time so no complaints there.  Be prepared to spend $$$ as everything here is over priced for what you get, like the 13 dollar margarita served in a tumbler sized glass filled with ice cubes.  The bartender might as well have flipped me the bird from across the room.  Nothing like paying 13 dollars for a half cup of margarita.  With all the great restaurants in this valley, I refuse to spend my hard earned money at places where the restaurant treats their patrons like second-class chumps.  I follow a three strike rule, and Spotted Donkey just struck out with me.  I won't be back.

Let's ignore the fact that my wife and two of my daughters were escorted to THE worst table in the restaurant despite it being half full at 8:30PM - and after making a reservation through the concierge at Boulders. Let's also ignore the fact that the clearly inexperienced hostess exhibited 'attitude' when another table was requested. Instead let's focus on the uninspiring food. Since it is it part of the Boulders Resort, expectations were fairly high, and the food was no better than the Mexican restaurant in your local strip mall. Outdoor dining area is quite nice, and the El Pedregal margarita was quite good. Our waiter was attentive and friendly. Overall, not recommended
Great for either a snack or a full meal. I don't think I'll ever order Nachos anywhere else. The Sopapillas were also standard-setting.
not a good ole Mexican restaurant.  can't manage to make guacamole properly. enough said.  Too touristy and I think I'm the only non white in the join other than the server/waitresses.

We have taken many friends here for an afternoon drink and apps.  I just love their loaded nachos.  They have delicious pulled pork, a red and green sauce that is wonderful and then loaded with cheese, a little sour cream and some fresh jalapeño slices on top.  What's not to love?  I keep wanting to try other things but get tricked into ordering those nachos every time!  Try them, I'm sure you'll love them.  I love the patio in good weather.  I've never eaten inside because it is Arizona!!

Poorly managed...felt like Robert from Restaurant: Impossible would show anytime to break up the gang of waiters gossiping near the door...hearing words like "nasty" made me cringe yet the enchilada was ok but certainly not worth $15.

Had dinner there with family and friend, 5 in all. Service was exceptional. No complaints there. The guacamole was very tasty, and the chips were thin and crispy. The pork tenderloin entree was delicious, a definite plus. The tacos and enchiladas were packed with braised beef and pork carnitas. All winners!  The carne asada was the exception. Though flavorful, there was very little meat on the plate. When you push aside the pepper and caramelized onion, there was perhaps half a cup of meat, quite a contrast from the pork tenderloin, tacos, and enchiladas.

As stated below, the food at Spotted Donkey is amazing. The help is friendly, but unobtrusive. I ordered the Chicken Burritos, and the waitress asked if I'd like to try one chicken and one beef instead. I accepted and it was amazing. Had a chocolate cake/hot fudge desert which was incredible too.

My hubby and I went to eat here and arrived in time for the happy hour.  Of course the wine I like was not on the happy hour list nor was my husbands beer.  Then we tried the 1/2 price appetizers.  We were not thrilled with much on the list of the 1/2 price appetizers but we tried the Camarones Tempura al Alambre.  The sauces were nothing to write home about.  I would not order it again.  For dinner we shared some sort of Mexican stew it was ok.  It seems like the place has gone down hill since somewhat in the last 6 months.  I don't know if it is a new chef or new recipes but you shouldn't mess with a good thing and it looks like they did. Right now I would not recommend it.

Ok - maybe my colleagues talked this one up a bit too much! The most I could give this place is my three star rating.   The parking was horrible - thank God it doesn't rain here because I'd be soaking wet by the time I got to the restaurant. The selection was ok, but I didn't think it had the variety it should have. The price wasn't the highest in town, but it certainly makes you think about it, which in turn makes you believe you'd get better food and service. Though the service wasn't lousy - when you charge the big bucks - people expect the best!  Overall cleanliness was ok - but again - not the best I've seen. The portion size and the overall flavor of the meal was also good - nothing to rant and rave about.  Would I go back - I doubt it - not because it's bad, but because it's sorta out of the way and didn't measure up for my return. If they sold baseball hats with their logo and name on it - I might be enticed to return though - of course they'd probably charge 35 bucks for a generic manufactured hat!
Food came out cold, over cooked and not at the same time...  I would not bring kids back here due to the poor service and the rude staff!

Have been here for brunch and drinks now....Enjoyed both the food and the super tasty margaritas.  These aren't the syrupy concoctions forced on us just about everywhere else.  These are awesome!.  Love the decor and the staff is very attentive.    Next visit is going to be planned for sunset!

Took my mother-in-law with the family for a Birthday brunch here last year. Beautiful drive up Scottsdale road to El Pedrigal. Upscales shops, and entertainment in the courtyard. We sat on the patio, with great views of the Boulders, and listened to the acoustic guitarist in the courtyard of the shopping center. Super atmosphere. The restaurant itself has a modern southwestern vibe that's perfect for a more sophisticated crowd. Creative, mexican menu with great margaritas, guacamole and poppers. My mother in law had the shrimp Caesar salad and loved it. A client introduced me to this on in El Pedrigal about 5 years ago. We find ourselves now going to the one on Hayden and Via De Ventura in Scottsdale since it is right by our office.

Do you know excellent service? Jill the bartender does! We were there before they opened on Sat. We wanted a Bloody Mary - she was very accommodating! Lunch was good too! For reasons I don't want to detail, we will definitely be back!! Jill and team know how to take care of their customers!!! Smiling faces abound!! Thanks for adding to our great day!

Could live on chips and salsa...if they were all as good at The Spotted Donkey! 2 visits in 2 days.  My friends swore by the signature nachos and didn't even share! Great salads, for those of us who overdosed on Blood Orange Margaritas and chips/salsa.  Fantastic service from Melissa - outstanding - friendly, efficient and with a smile. Worth the visit.  Cold Victoria draft (from Mexico) and delicious margaritas. Designated driver. Enjoy the outdoor patio if at all possible. Had to fly back to cold snowy Washington DC the next day. Sad!

This place use to be terrific but seems to be going down.  Last visit service was poor, food was bland, and overall experience was disappointing.  Maybe they were having a bad night....who knows...but it is fairly expensive for what is offered.  Much better places in the area.

Spotted Donkey is located in a much deserted Pedregal shopping plaza.  We stopped in for some lunch while vacationing in AZ.  The interior of the restaurant is nicely decorated with it's tile floors, wrought iron decor, paintings and beautiful light fixtures.  The staff was friendly and the food was good, with generous helpings.  My order of Chicken and Beef enchiladas was tasty.  It's tough to give Spotted Donkey more than an average rating, having had some excellent Mexican food in AZ and CA.  That's not to say the food isn't good, it is, it's just not the worst nor the best I've eaten.    Overall I would say the Spotted Donkey is a nice restaurant with a good sized bar, nice ambiance and decent food.  If you're near Pedregal, it's worth stopping by.

Came here on a Saturday night and it was pretty busy. However, that is no excuse to have your food arrive OVER AN HOUR after you order it.   The food is mediocre at best and is a SAD excuse for Mexican food. Arizona is a great place for Mexican food and the Spotted Donkey definitely missed that mark.   The ONLY thing good about this place are the mints which you can grab freely at the hostess counter. I grabbed about 20 mints to be able to feel better about spending my money at this place.  I'm hoping that I won't be spending my night shitting my brains out. Wish me luck!

Ate here last year and it was over priced. Decided to try again this year. Arrived at 5:30 to an empty restaurant and patio only to be told they had no openings and the to have the hostess take a phone call right in the middle of our discussion.  So we just walked out.  We will never be back.  Would give zero stars if i could.
Nice folks working there, good food, beautiful views
Always good food in a great decor.  We especially love to eat on the patio.  Try the Donkey Nachos or the Shrimp Ceviche, you won't regret it!
Best Southwest Mexican in North Scottsdale / Cave Creek area!  Try the stuffed poblano peppers and the towering nachos!!!

Stopped in for lunch on New Year's Eve. We wanted to try the original location after finding the "new" location at Hayden Village. Best nachos we have ever had. However had to knock my review down to 4 stars as the bartender was a little smug and not very friendly. I prefer the ambiance and service at the Hayden Village location. The food is fantastic at both places.

Stupid policy on happy hour. You must sit at the bar for the happy hour pricing. If you sit at a table the beer prices go up to regular pricing. So drink water. Also no chips and salsa. The food is good and fast but the happy hour is just dumb.

Ok...expected the gringo resort treatment and came away impressed by the nacho's and poblano chiles: authentic yet very well presented.  Nice atmosphere too. A tad pricy, but well worth it for the unique treatment of  Mexican standards. Highly recommend it.  Oh and the 'short' plate of nacho's is PLENTY!

Came here with my wife while staying at the Boulders resort in July '16.  PROS: The fried jalapeno shooters were excellent. Highly recommended. CONS: I killed a scorpion that was on the wall right behind my head. Smashed it with my napkin. The waitress gave us a free desert because of it after I showed her the dead fella, but the service was sub-par the entire meal at best. Lots of waiting and we had to request little things like silverware multiple times. Outside of the shooters, the meals were not impressive either.
Chicken Tortilla Warm spinach salad good healthy choice.  Fajitas were also tasty and clean.  Not South Tex MX food in any way shape or form. Cool vibe. Moderate to expensive.

Excellent food. The Arizona Mac and Cheese was one of the best things I've ever eaten. Good margaritas, tasty salsas, easy walk from the Boulders. We would absolutely go again. Next time, however, I would request a seat near the window to watch the sunset. This place gets crowded and a little loud.

Spotted Donkey Cantina is amazing!  They have delicious Mexican food, and fantastic margaritas to wash everything down with. You do have to pay for chips and salsa here, so there probably won't be any of that four bowl snacking before your main entree's come, but the medley of salsa's it comes with make it all worth it.  I've tried quite a few of the dishes here, and they've all been excellent.  In no particular order are my favorites: cheddar enchilada's with hatch chiles and rice...spicy! santa fe macaroni and cheese...again- spicy! cod and shrimp tostada's- delicious! shrimp fajitas shrimp tacos  And for dessert: fried banana wraps or the mango margarita sundae!"

Our THIRD visit. What a disappointment!!   On two prior occasions our food orders were messed up. Wrong meat in the orders of two people in our party of four. Tonight we sat on the patio as the weather was great.  No lighting on the tables.  When we asked our waiter for a flashlight, he came up empty handed. Tonight, a mess-up on a food order once more......!!!!  Soon after placing our beverage orders our waiter, Andres, came buy THREE times in a span of 10 mins and told us our drinks would be out soon!!! (How long does it take to pop a top off a beer and to pour your house margarita??) He also had us waiting for what seemed forever to bring us our bill after he collected the dishes from the table. Dishes are pricey, no condiments on the table (you have to ask), no complimentary chips and salsa (you have to order these items from the menu). We are rather disappointed in our third visit (as we were in the last two) and will NOT visit again despite us loving the atmosphere and the ambiance.  Also, the lighting as you head to the parking lot leaves much to be desired, and if you have issues with night vision, this is an accident waiting to happen. Our lovely little town of Cave Creek has many other lovely places that we shall support!!
Sloooooooooow service! Love the ambiance and the views. Waiter was a little bit of a smart Aleck. A little humility goes a long way!

Had a late lunch today with a friend who has cancer.  We both ordered the Enchiladas and loved every bite.  Not for sissies, the sauce packed a punch, JUST RIGHT.  I fought myself between those and the Stuffed Poblanos...another favorite.  And don't forget to share an order of the Jalepenos Poppers!!!   I can't speak for the Margaritas as I don't drink them so if YOU don't like them, have a Victoria draft and dive into some of the best Mex food in the Valley!!!  And, the service was great, as always.

Scotty had great margarita recommendations, worthy of a refill. Don't miss the shooters app, best fried jalapeños. My wife had their special Mac & Cheese. I had pork tenderloin with M&C. A fabulous experience! It was a rare, cold night and we they wanted us to wait 30 min. I walked out, but was convinced it would take that long to go to another place.  Am glad we went back in and waited for a table.

Nothing spectacular about the food here. The drinks are strong. Reservations are a must which can be a pain with large groups, especially when you are locked in a resort without many choices to begin with.

I always leave Spotted Donkey satisfied...mostly because I always get the pork nachos to start off the meal! Every dish I have had has been great.  Favorites are the Carne Asada, Enchiladas, AZ Mac & Cheese. Service has always been good, not great...sometimes can be a little slow (table full of empty water glasses probably means you should bring a pitcher over once in a while...just sayin').  Margaritas are solid & beer is cold!

Great Awesome Mexican Restaurant     Great food   awesome service  Susan the Manager so attentive and sweet Doug the Waiter will make sure your food is perfect and any adhere to Any food Allergies  (they have made my food to order)  and John the Waiter incredible  Go here you will not be disappointed

The restaurant is beautiful but everything else was downhill. The Margarita on the rocks was mostly rocks and tasted like the too sweet premix they sell in the grocery store. The chopped salad was good but the main meatloaf entree tasted like spotted donkey. This is one of the restaurants at the Boulders resort in Carefree and the entire staff from the bellhops to the front desk recommended it a little too hard which aroused my suspicions. I have to believe there is a lot better Mexican food in this part of Arizona. Our waitress was on automatic pilot so no help there.

Spotted Donkey - Not the Best Restaurant Experience   The resort staff at Boulders Resort and Spa hyped this place up, which made us excited to have made reservations here prior to checking in at the resort. We arrive and asked for a table on the patio, which would not be available for 20 min, which was fine. We decided to sit at the bar until the table was ready. The bar staff was on point. They were friendly and attentive. The tequila menu had shots that ranged from $11 and up.   Our table was ready and we headed to the patio and were seated with no menus. At least 20 min went by and the table next to us had to tell their waitress that we have not yet been seen. The waitress then gives us menus and flags down a waiter who apparently was tending to customers inside. He was clearly not happy about having to tend to our table. He was visibly overwhelmed and annoyed.   Another 20 min go by and still our waiter has not come to take our order. We flag down a waitress by the name of Kelly, she was awesome! She was super apologetic & took our order. She even comp'd our appetizer and upon speaking w/ her manager, gave us a discount on our overall dinner for the super slow service and inconvenience.   2 tables next to us were also having issues w/ their dinner service. One customer was upset about the fajitas she received and sent them back and was not interested in staying there after that. The other table was having issues w/ their bill, which made us feel like the staff at Spotted Donkey was having a bad/rough night.    My wife really enjoyed her Poblano Chile Relleno. I on the other hand thought my Fajitas de la Cantina (shrimp) were ok. Not the best, but definitely not the worst I have had.   On the shuttle ride back to the room, our driver asked how the experience was at Spotted Donkey and we told him what happened.
